'''Adrián San Miguel del Castillo''', simply known as '''Adrián''' (born 3 January 1987), is a Spanish professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for English club [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] as a [[Goalkeeper (association football)|goalkeeper]].

He started playing for [[Real Betis|Betis]], making his debut with the first team in 2012.

==Club career==
===Betis===
Born in [[Seville]], [[Andalusia]], Adrián was a product of hometown [[Real Betis]]' youth ranks, after having begun playing as a [[Forward (association football)|forward]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eldesmarque.com/betis/48197-la-historia-de-adrian-el-portero-que-empezo-de-delantero-video|title=La historia de Adrián, el portero que empezó de delantero (vídeo)|trans_title=The story of Adrián, the goalkeeper who started as a forward (video)|publisher=El Desmarque|language=Spanish|accessdate=12 October 2012|date=6 June 2013}}</ref> He spent his first five senior seasons with [[Real Betis B|the reserves]], four of those in [[Segunda División B]], successively backing up [[René Hinojo|René]] and [[Brimah Razak]],<ref>[http://www.estadiodeportivo.com/betis.php?pg=2&id=33629 Con Adrián, el Betis está en buenas manos (With Adrián, Betis is in good hands)]; Estadio Deportivo, 24 October 2012 {{es icon}}</ref> and was also loaned to [[CD Alcalá]] in 2008 and [[Club Deportivo Utrera|CD Utrera]] the following year.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.whufc.com/articles/null-adrian-west-ham_2228487_46996|title=Adrian|publisher=West Ham United|accessdate=5 February 2015}}</ref> He was promoted to the first team for the [[2011–12 La Liga|2011–12 season]] as third-choice&nbsp;– still continuing to appear for the B's&nbsp;– but suffered a severe [[knee]] injury in November that kept him out of action for several months.<ref>[http://www.diariodesevilla.es/article/realbetis/1110680/portero/adriaacuten/estaraacute/baja/medio/antildeo/por/una/lesioacuten/rodilla.html El portero Adrián estará de baja medio año por una lesión de rodilla (Goalkeeper Adrián will miss half a year due to knee injury)]; Diario de Sevilla, 10 November 2011 {{es icon}}</ref>

Adrián made his [[La Liga]] debut on 29 September 2012, in a 0–4 away loss against [[Málaga CF]]: after [[Casto (footballer)|Casto]] was [[Ejection (sports)|sent off]] in the early minutes, he [[Substitute (association football)|replaced]] field player [[Salvador Agra]].<ref>[http://espnfc.com/uk/en/report/348458/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=5739 Malaga crush 10-man Betis]; [[ESPN Soccernet]], 29 September 2012</ref> Still in the [[2012–13 La Liga|2012–13 campaign]] he became the starter, namely putting on a ''[[Man of the match]]'' performance in a 1–0 home win against [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] on 24 November.<ref>[http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report?id=348394&cc=5739 Betis stun Real Madrid]; ESPN Soccernet, 24 November 2012</ref> Following his debut he went on to start the next 31 games, keeping eleven [[Shutout|clean sheets]] as the club finished in seventh place and [[2013-14 UEFA Europa League|qualified]] to the [[UEFA Europa League]].<ref name=whusign/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://deportes.elpais.com/deportes/2013/04/19/actualidad/1366393799_979093.html|title=Diego López se lo ha ganado|trans_title=Diego López has done very well for himself|publisher=[[El País]]|language=Spanish|date=19 April 2013|accessdate=6 June 2013}}</ref>

===West Ham United===
On 5 June 2013, it was announced that Adrián would join [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] on 1 July, on a three-year contract.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11685/8758851/West-Ham-secure-the-signing-of-Spanish-keeper-Adrian|title=West Ham secure the signing of Spanish keeper Adrian|publisher=[[Sky Sports]]|date=5 June 2013|accessdate=5 June 2013}}</ref> The [[Premier League]] club had the option to extend this deal for a further two seasons.<ref name="whusign">{{cite web|url=http://www.whufc.com/articles/20130605/hammers-catch-goalkeeper-adrian_2236884_3201244|title=Hammers catch keeper Adrian|publisher=West Ham United|date=5 June 2013|accessdate=6 June 2013}}</ref>

Adrián made his debut for the Hammers on 27 August 2013, in a 2–1 home win against [[Cheltenham Town F.C.|Cheltenham Town]] for [[2013–14 Football League Cup|the season]]'s [[Football League Cup|League Cup]]: during the game he fouled [[Jermaine McGlashan]] to concede a [[Penalty kick|penalty]], which [[Matt Richards (footballer born 1984)|Matt Richards]] converted.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sport.co.uk/football/west-ham-21-cheltenham-match-report/4383702/|title=West Ham 2–1 Cheltenham: Match report|publisher=Sport.co|date=27 August 2013|accessdate=29 August 2013}}</ref> His first league appearance came on 21 December, a 1–3 loss at [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://espnfc.com/uk/en/report/367335/report.html|title=United revival gathering pace|publisher=ESPN FC|date=21 December 2013|accessdate=22 December 2013}}</ref>

On 11 January 2014 Adrián kept his first Premier League clean sheet, in the 2–0 away win over [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ftbpro.com/posts/paul.websell/616310/jussi-or-adrian-who-should-be-west-ham-s-number-one|title=Jussi or Adrian: Who should be West Ham's number one?|publisher=FTB Pro|author=Websell, Paul|date=15 January 2014|accessdate=9 February 2014}}</ref> On 6 May he attended the club's awards and won 'Save of the Season' for a fingertip save from [[Oscar (footballer born 1991)|Oscar]] against [[Chelsea F.C|Chelsea]] in January. He also won 'Best Individual Performance' for the same game, in which he kept a clean sheet in a goalless draw, as well as 'Signing of the Season'; he was also named runner-up '[[West Ham United F.C.#Hammer of the Year|Hammer of the Year]]' to [[Mark Noble]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.whufc.com/articles/20140506/201314-player-awards-live_2236884_3809162|title=Noble is Hammer of the Year|publisher=West Ham United|date=6 May 2014|accessdate=6 May 2014}}</ref>

In an [[FA Cup]] third-round replay [[Penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shootout]] against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] on 13 January 2015, Adrián saved from [[Steven Naismith]]. The shootout went to sudden death, in which he scored the winner after his Everton counterpart, compatriot [[Joel Robles|Joel]], struck the crossbar.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Emons|first1=Michael|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30705802|title=West Ham 2–2 Everton|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=13 January 2015|accessdate=14 January 2015}}</ref> Despite having never taken a competitive penalty before, he was so confident that he would score and win the game that he removed his [[Kit (association football)#Other equipment|goalkeeping gloves]] before taking it&nbsp;– his team won it 9–8.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30808244|title=Adrian: West Ham keeper knew he would score FA Cup penalty|publisher=BBC Sport|date=13 January 2015|accessdate=14 January 2015}}</ref>

On 11 February, Adrián was given a straight red card in a goalless draw at [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] for handling the ball outside the penalty area while pressured by [[Sadio Mané]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Reddy|first1=Luke|title=Southampton 0–0 West Ham|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31124632|accessdate=13 February 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=11 February 2015}}</ref> His suspension for this dismissal was rescinded by the [[Football Association|FA]], although West Ham were charged with failing to control their players following the incident.<ref>{{cite news|title=Adrian: West Ham keeper's red card overturned, but club charged|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31459377|accessdate=13 February 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=13 February 2015}}</ref>

'''Kieran Ricardo Agard''' (born 10 October 1989) is an English [[association football|footballer]] who plays for [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]] as a [[Forward (association football)|forward]] or a [[Midfielder (association football)#Winger|winger]].

==Career==
Born in London, of [[Jamaican]],<ref>{{Cite web|title=One to watch: Kieran Agard|url=http://www.stokecity-mad.co.uk/feat/edz5/one_to_watch_48_kieran_agard_530896/index.shtml|publisher=Stoke City Mad}}</ref> [[Saint Vincent and the Grenadines|Vincentian]] and [[Commonwealth of Dominica|Dominican]]<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/everton-fc/everton-fc-news/2009/12/31/everton-fc-young-gun-kieran-agard-wanted-by-hearts-100252-25498134/ |title=Everton FC young gun Kieran Agard wanted by Hearts |newspaper=Liverpool Echo |date=31 December 2009 |accessdate=16 December 2010}}</ref> descent, Agard started in the [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] [[Arsenal F.C. Academy|Academy]] before moving to [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] in the [[2005–06 in English football|2005–06]] season.<ref name=efcprofile>{{Cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/player-profile/kieran-agard|title=Kieran Agard|publisher=Everton F.C.|accessdate=2 October 2009}}</ref> He played for the club's under-18 team, before moving into the [[reserve team]], becoming the reserve team player of the year in [[2008–09 in English football|2008–09]].<ref name=efcprofile/>

===Everton===
His [[first team]] debut came in a 4–0 away win at [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] in a [[Football League Cup|League Cup]] match in September 2009.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/match/report/0910/hull-v-everton.html?page=full|title=Hull v Everton|date=23 September 2009|accessdate=2 October 2009|publisher=Everton F.C.}}</ref> He made his [[Premier League]] debut against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], coming on as a [[substitute (association football)|substitute]] for [[Louis Saha]] in stoppage time.<ref>[http://www.soccerbase.com/results3.sd?gameid=606838 Chelsea 3–3 Everton]</ref> At the end of the 2010–11 season, he was released by Everton along with goalkeeper [[Iain Turner]] and [[Hope Akpan]] after their contracts with the club expired.<ref>{{cite news|title=Everton release trio|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11671/6962223/Everton-release-trio|publisher=Sky Sports|date=1 June 2011|accessdate=17 April 2012}}</ref>

===Peterborough United===
On 6 January 2011, he joined [[Peterborough United F.C.|Peterborough United]] on [[loan (sports)|loan]] until the end of the [[2010–11 in English football|2010–11]] season,<ref>{{Cite news |title=Peterborough United sign Everton youngster Kieran Agard |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/p/peterborough_united/9344971.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=6 January 2011 |accessdate=7 January 2011}}</ref> but after playing just once, in the [[FA Cup]],<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.soccerbase.com/players_details.sd?playerid=49715&seasonid=140 |title=Games played by Kieran Agard in 2010/2011 |work=Soccerbase |publisher=Centurycomm |accessdate=1 February 2011}}</ref> a change of management left Agard surplus to requirements and the loan was cut short.

===Kilmarnock===
On 31 January 2011 Agard joined [[Scottish Premier League]] club [[Kilmarnock F.C.|Kilmarnock]], also on loan.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Kilmarnock sign midfielder Scott Evans and Kieran Agard |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/k/kilmarnock/9382353.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=31 January 2011 |accessdate=1 February 2011}}</ref> and made his debut in the Scottish Premier League as Kilmarnock lose to [[Hibernian F.C.|Hibernian]] 2–1 on 12 February 2011<ref>{{cite news|title=Hibernian 2 – 1 Kilmarnock|url=http://www.kilmarnockfc.co.uk/articles/20110212/hibernian-2-kilmarnock-1_85931_53656|publisher=Kilmarnockfc.co|date=12 February 2011|accessdate=17 April 2012}}</ref> before scoring his first goal in Scotland against [[Heart of Midlothian F.C.|Hearts]] in a 2–2 draw on 30 April 2011.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.kilmarnockfc.co.uk/articles/20110430/kilmarnock-2-hearts-2_85931_55045|title=Kilmarnock 2 – 2 Hearts|publisher=Kilmarnockfc.co|date=30 April 2011|accessdate=17 April 2012}}</ref>

===Yeovil Town===
Agard, following his release from Everton, signed a one-year deal with [[Yeovil Town F.C.|Yeovil Town]] on 22 June 2011.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.ytfc.net/page/NewsDetail/0,,10673~2379933,00.html |title=Kieran joins the Glovers |publisher=Yeovil Town FC |date=22 June 2011 |accessdate=22 June 2011}}</ref> The club's management was first alerted to Agard's availability after asking fans to suggest signings on Twitter, to which Agard became known as football's first 'twansfer'.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/13902298.stm |title=Yeovil Town boss Terry Skiverton hails first 'twansfer' |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 June 2011 |accessdate=24 June 2011}}</ref>

He scored his first two goals for the Glovers in a 3–2 defeat to [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]] on 17 September 2011.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.ytfc.net/page/MatchReport/0,,10673~58123,00.html|title=Yeovil 2 – 3 Sheffield Wednesday|publisher=Yeovil Town FC|date=17 September 2011|accessdate=17 April 2012}}</ref> He then went on to score against Bury and Leyton Orient, also winning two penalties for his team. He also scored a winner against Wycombe Wanderers, but was sent off against Colchester United a week later.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.ytfc.net/page/MatchReport/0,,10673~59249,00.html|title=Yeovil 3 – 2 Colchester United|publisher=Yeovil Town FC|date=18 February 2012|accessdate=17 April 2012}}</ref> His next goal was in the 3 – 2 win over Chesterfield at Huish Park.<ref>{{cite news|title=Yeovil Town 3–2 Chesterfield|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17796281|publisher=BBC Sport|date=28 April 2012|accessdate=8 May 2012}}</ref> He finished the season with 29 appearances in the league, and 6 goals. On 8 May 2012, Agard was released from Yeovil Town after just one year at the club.<ref>{{cite news|title=KIERAN LEAVES HUISH PARK|url=http://www.ytfc.net/page/NewsDetail/0,,10673~2763533,00.html|publisher=Yeovil Town Website|date=8 May 2012|accessdate=8 May 2012}}</ref>

===Rotherham United===
====2012–13 season====
After being released by [[Yeovil Town F.C.|Yeovil Town]], it was revealed that [[Rotherham United F.C.|Rotherham]] were interested in Agard. They were initially unable to agree terms with the player, but he eventually featured in a pre-season match against [[Doncaster Rovers F.C.|Doncaster Rovers]] as part of a trial. On 27 July an agreement was reached for Agard to sign for Rotherham.<ref>{{cite news|title=Young Agard Becomes A Miller |url=http://www.themillers.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10360~2862934,00.html |publisher=Rotherham United Official Website |date=27 July 2012 |accessdate=27 July 2012}}</ref>

Agard scored his first goal for the club on 27 October, in a 1–0 win against [[Plymouth Argyle F.C.|Plymouth Argyle]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20014309 |title=Rotherham 1–0 Plymouth |date=27 October 2012 |accessdate=8 October 2013 |publisher=BBC}}</ref> In December, he scored in successive games against [[AFC Wimbledon]] and [[Port Vale F.C.|Port Vale]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20650375 |title=AFC Wimbledon 0–1 Rotherham |date=15 December 2012 |accessdate=8 October 2013 |publisher=BBC}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20778954 |title=Rotherham 1–2 Port Vale |date=26 December 2012 |accessdate=8 October 2013 |publisher=BBC}}</ref>

In April 2013, Agard scored in three successive wins against [[Fleetwood Town F.C.|Fleetwood Town]], [[Bradford City A.F.C.|Bradford City]] and Plymouth Argyle,<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22049586 |title=Rotherham 2–1 Fleetwood |date=13 April 2013 |accessdate=8 October 2013 |publisher=BBC}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22075479 |title=Bradford 0–2 Rotherham |date=16 April 2013 |accessdate=8 October 2013 |publisher=BBC}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22133498 |title=Plymouth 0–1 Rotherham |date=20 April 2013 |accessdate=8 October 2013 |publisher=BBC}}</ref> contributing greatly to the clubs' automatic promotion to [[Football League One|League One]] later that month.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22228779 |title=Rotherham 2–0 Aldershot |date=27 April 2013 |accessdate=8 October 2013 |publisher=BBC}}</ref>

====2013–14 season====
He scored his first goal of the [[2013–14 Rotherham United F.C. season|2013–14 season]] on 17 August, in a 2–1 win against [[Crawley Town F.C.|Crawley Town]],<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23644697 |title=Crawley Town 1–2 Rotherham |date=17 August 2014 |accessdate=8 October 2013 |publisher=BBC}}</ref> before scoring in successive wins against [[Notts County F.C.|Notts County]] and [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23822749 |title=Notts County 0–1 Rotherham |date=31 August 2013 |accessdate=8 October 2013 |publisher=BBC}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23910057 |title=Rotherham 3–1 Sheffield Utd |date=7 September 2013 |accessdate=8 October 2013 |publisher=BBC}}</ref>

Agard scored his first ever cup goal on 8 October, in a 3–0 victory away to [[York City F.C.|York City]] in the [[Football League Trophy]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/24350152 |title=York 0–3 Rotherham |date=8 October 2013 |accessdate=8 October 2013 |publisher=BBC}}</ref> On 18 April, he scored a hat-trick against [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] in a 6–4 defeat.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/26983300 |title=Wolves 6–4 Rotherham |date=18 April 2014 |accessdate=18 April 2014 |publisher=BBC}}</ref> During May 2014, Agard won the [[League 1]] player of the month award for April, after a run of scoring 5 goals in 6 games.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.sportsmole.co.uk/football/rotherham-united/news/agard-picks-up-monthly-award_152805.html |title=Rotherham United's Kieran Agard scoops League One Player of the Month award |date=2 May 2014 |accessdate=2 May 2014 |publisher=Sports Mole}}</ref>

During the 2013/14 season, Agard scored 26 goals in all competitions, with Agard finishing the 3rd top scorer in [[League 1]] behind [[Sam Baldock]] and [[Britt Assombalonga]] with 21 of his 26 goals coming in [[League 1]], his goals helped Rotherham reach the [[League 1]] playoff final. Agard played in the final, and after a 2–2 draw, [[Rotherham United F.C.|Rotherham]] earned promotion after beating [[Leyton Orient]] 4–3 on penalties (with Agard scoring Rotherham's first penalty) to earn a second successive promotion.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27459498 |title=Leyton Orient 2–2 Rotherham |date=25 May 2014 |accessdate=25 May 2014 |publisher=BBC}}</ref>

At the end of the 2013/14 season, Agard was out of contract, however on 9 July 2014, [[Rotherham United F.C.|Rotherham]] exercised an option in Agard's contract to extend it for another year. Agard turned down [[Rotherham United F.C.|Rotherham]]'s offer to extend his contract beyond the year option that was exercised by the club.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11747/9376742/transfer-news-kieran-agard-shuns-rotherham-contract-offer |title=Rotherham star Kieran Agard turns down offer of a contract extension |date=9 July 2014 |accessdate=9 July 2014 |publisher=Sky Sports}}</ref>

====2014–15 season====
On 9 August 2014, Agard started for [[Rotherham United F.C.|Rotherham]] in their opening fixture of [[Football League Championship|The Championship]] season in a 1–0 defeat against [[Derby County]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/313770/report |title=Championship: Derby County beat Rotherham United 1–0 at the iPro Stadium |date=9 August 2014 |accessdate=9 August 2014 |publisher=Sky Sports}}</ref> On 15 August, [[Leeds United]] had a bid accepted for Agard, however, after holding talks with Leeds and unable to agree personal terms, the move fell through.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.yorkshireeveningpost.co.uk/sport/leeds-united/latest-whites-news/leeds-united-agard-move-collapses-1-6787792 |title=Leeds United: Agard move collapses|date=15 August 2014 |accessdate=15 August 2014 |publisher=Yorkshire Evening Post}}</ref>

===Bristol City===
On 21 August 2014, Agard signed for League One side [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]] for an undisclosed fee, thought to be in the region of £750,000.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.bcfc.co.uk/news/article/20140821-kieranagard-1849797.aspx |title=City secure striker Agard |publisher=Bristol City F.C. |date=21 August 2014 |accessdate=21 August 2014 }}</ref>

==International Career==
Born in [[England]], Agard is also eligible to play for [[Jamaica]],<ref>{{Cite web|title=One to watch: Kieran Agard|url=http://www.stokecity-mad.co.uk/feat/edz5/one_to_watch_48_kieran_agard_530896/index.shtml|publisher=Stoke City Mad}}</ref> [[Saint Vincent and the Grenadines]] and [[Commonwealth of Dominica|Dominica]]<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/everton-fc/everton-fc-news/2009/12/31/everton-fc-young-gun-kieran-agard-wanted-by-hearts-100252-25498134/ |title=Everton FC young gun Kieran Agard wanted by Hearts |newspaper=Liverpool Echo |date=31 December 2009 |accessdate=16 December 2010}}</ref> due to his heritage.

'''Didier Fernand Agathe''' (born 16 August 1975) is a professional [[Association football|footballer]] who currently plays for [[JS Saint-Pierroise]] in Réunion.

Agathe began his career at French side [[Montpellier HSC]] before moving to Scotland to join [[Raith Rovers F.C.|Raith Rovers]] and then [[Hibernian F.C.|Hibernian]]. His performances gained him a high profile transfer to [[Celtic F.C.|Celtic]] where he enjoyed the most successful spell of his career winning three championships and was part of the squad that reached the [[2003 UEFA Cup Final]].

== Career ==

===Early career===
Agathe began his career in [[Ligue 1|France]] with [[Montpellier HSC]] and also had a loan spell with [[Olympique Alès]].

===Raith Rovers===
He moved to [[Scotland]] in 1999, playing for a year with [[Raith Rovers F.C.|Raith Rovers]]. At this time he was playing as a [[forward (association football)|striker]]. His goals alerted [[Scottish Premier League|Premier League]] club [[Hibernian F.C.|Hibernian]], who signed him on a short-term contract in the summer of 2000.

===Hibernian===
Agathe scored four goals in five [[Scottish Premier League]] games for Hibs, who also used him as a [[forward (association football)|striker]].

===Celtic===
This form and his short contract led to Celtic stepping in to sign Agathe for just [[Pound sterling|£]]35,000. [[Martin O'Neill]] used Agathe as either a [[Defender (association football)#Full back|right back]] or [[Defender (association football)#Wing-back|right wingback]] and was a regular in his side. The club won three championships and reached the [[2003 UEFA Cup Final]].<ref name = "academy"/> Following good performances in European competition he was once linked with moves to [[Juventus FC|Juventus]] and [[Valencia CF|Valencia]] during the 2001–02 season.{{Citation needed|date=June 2009}}. In February 2004, the [[Scotland national football team|Scotland]] manager [[Berti Vogts]] expressed interest in selecting Agathe.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/football/2004/feb/02/match.sport14 |title=Dour debut for other De Boer |work=[[The Guardian]] |last=Clark |first=Graham |accessdate=14 August 2010 |date=2 February 2004}}</ref>

Agathe hardly featured during the [[2005-06 in Scottish football|2005–06 season]] under new manager [[Gordon Strachan]], and was [[free transfer (football)|released]] at the end of the season.

===Aston Villa===
Agathe underwent a trial at [[Premier League]] side [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]] prior to the [[2006-07 in English football|2006–07 season]]. He began training with [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]], managed by his former [[Celtic F.C.|Celtic]] boss [[Martin O'Neill]], after his attempt at joining Blackburn was unsuccessful. He agreed a short term contract and made his Villa début at home to [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] in a 1–1 draw. On 11 January 2007, however, Agathe parted company with Aston Villa, after they chose not to extend his short term contract.<ref>{{cite news |author= |title=Agathe parts company with Villa |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/teams/a/aston_villa/6253691.stm |work=BBC|date=11 January 2007|accessdate=13 January 2007}}</ref> Agathe made a total of six substitute appearances in his short time at [[Villa Park (stadium)|Villa Park]], but did not start a single game.

===JS Saint-Pierroise===
He then signed for [[JS Saint-Pierroise]], a club in his homeland of [[Réunion]].

Agathe has set up an academy for young footballers on [[Réunion]].<ref name = "academy">{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/s/stirling_albion/8911389.stm |title=Three join Stirling Albion from Agathe's academy |publisher=[[BBC Sport]] |date=13 August 2010 |accessdate=13 August 2010}}</ref> Three players – Heeking Jerome, Mathis Yohan and Jeremy Judith – signed for [[Stirling Albion F.C.|Stirling Albion]] in August 2010.<ref name = "academy"/>

On 8 September 2013, Agathe played for the "Celtic XI" during the [[Stiliyan Petrov]] charity match put on by Celtic FC.<ref>http://www.footballorgin.com/2013/09/charity-match-celtic-legends-xi-v.html</ref>

== Film ==

Agathe, who played over 100 league games for Celtic, was portrayed in fiction as a [[Rangers F.C.|Rangers]] striker in the [[Robert Duvall]] movie, ''[[A Shot at Glory]]''.<ref>[http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0193854/trivia Trivia for A Shot at Glory], [[Internet Movie Database]].</ref>

'''Gabriel Imuetinyan "Gabby" Agbonlahor''' (born 13 October 1986), is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] as a [[Forward (association football)|forward]].

He is a product of [[Aston Villa F.C. Reserves and Academy|Aston Villa's Academy]], and made his first-team debut in 2006 following loans to [[The Football League|Football League]] clubs [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] and [[Sheffield Wednesday]]. Since then, he has made 300 [[Premier League]] appearances for the club, scoring in ten consecutive seasons.  With 73 goals, he is Aston Villa's all-time leading [[Premier League]] goalscorer, having scored in ten consecutive league seasons.

Formerly a regular with [[England national under-21 football team|England under-21]], Agbonlahor made his senior international debut in 2008 and earned three caps overall.

==Club career==
===2005–06 season===
Agbonlahor came through the youth ranks at local club Aston Villa. He signed a two-year professional contract at the club in June 2005.<ref name=watford>{{cite news|title=Watford seal Agbonlahor loan deal|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/w/watford/4271784.stm|accessdate=14 March 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=22 September 2005}}</ref> On 22 September 2005, he was loaned to Championship club [[Watford F.C.|Watford]],<ref name=watford/> where he made his senior debut six days later, replacing [[Trevor Benjamin]] at half time in a 1&ndash;3 defeat away to [[Coventry City]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Coventry 3-1 Watford|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_1/4277762.stm|accessdate=14 March 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=28 September 2005}}</ref> He made his first start in his only other match for Watford, a goalless draw against [[Leeds United]] at [[Vicarage Road]] on 1 October, in which he made way for [[Francino Francis]] after 65 minutes.<ref>{{cite news|title=Watford 0-0 Leeds|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_1/4277798.stm|accessdate=14 March 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=1 October 2005}}</ref> Agbonlahor was loaned to another team from the division on 28 October, [[Sheffield Wednesday]],<ref>{{cite news|title=Transfers - October 2005|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/gossip_and_transfers/4305252.stm|accessdate=14 March 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=28 October 2005}}</ref> where he made eight appearances without scoring.

Agbonlahor's [[Premier League]] debut for Villa came on 18 March 2006 at the age of 19, under manager [[David O'Leary]], against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] at [[Goodison Park]]. O'Leary was forced to delve into the youth academy because of a lack of senior strikers due to injury, thus earning Agbonlahor a rare start. He scored after 63 minutes, although Villa went on to lose the match 4–1.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Everton 4–1 Aston Villa |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/4796520.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 March 2006 |accessdate=17 August 2008 }}</ref>

===2006–07 season===
In five pre-season games of the [[2006–07 Aston Villa F.C. season|2006–07 season]], Agbonlahor netted three goals for Aston Villa; a quick double salvo against [[Walsall F.C.|Walsall]] (the first a near-post header, the latter a close range finish) in a 5–0 victory,<ref>{{Cite news |title=Villa thrash Walsall in friendly |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/a/aston_villa/5205308.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 July 2006 |accessdate=17 August 2008 }}</ref> and a consolation strike in a 2–1 defeat at [[NEC (football club)|NEC]].<ref>{{Cite news|title=NEC Nijmegen 2, Villa 1 |url=http://www.birminghammail.net/birmingham-sport/aston-villa-fc/aston-villa-match-reports/2006/08/08/nec-nijmegen-2-villa-1-97319-17531850/ |newspaper=[[Birmingham Mail]] |date=8 August 2006 |accessdate=17 August 2008 }}</ref>

Agbonlahor started the season on the right wing in [[Martin O'Neill]]'s new-look Villa side, and would be part of the team that managed to get a point from the first Premiership game at [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]]'s new [[Emirates Stadium]].<ref>{{Cite news |title=Arsenal 1–1 Aston Villa|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/4786655.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=19 August 2006 |accessdate=17 August 2008 |first=Simon | last=Austin }}</ref> Agbonlahor's first goal of the season came at home against [[Charlton Athletic F.C.|Charlton Athletic]], in a 2–0 win.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Aston Villa 2–0 Charlton |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/5351926.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=23 September 2006 |accessdate=17 August 2008 |first=Nathan |last=Mercer}}</ref> On 30 September, Agbonlahor scored a crucial equaliser against Premiership champions [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] just before half-time, heading in [[Liam Ridgewell]]'s cross with a glancing header to earn Villa a 1–1 draw.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Chelsea 1–1 Aston Villa |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/5373472.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=30 September 2006 |accessdate=17 August 2008 |first=Caroline |last=Cheese }}</ref>

Agbonlahor also provided cup heroics in 2006, scoring an injury-time winner to beat [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]] 3–2 at the [[Walkers Stadium]].<ref>{{Cite news |title=Leicester 2–3 Aston Villa (aet) |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/league_cup/6072636.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 October 2006 |accessdate=17 August 2008 }}</ref> The following game, he scored a consolation effort in Villa's first loss of the season, on 28 October, ten games in.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Liverpool 3–1 Aston Villa |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/6072868.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 October 2006 |accessdate=17 August 2008 |first=John |last=Sinnott }}</ref>

Agbonlahor completed his run of scoring against the so-called "[[Premier league#"Big Four" dominance|Big Four]]", when he added [[Manchester United]] to a list of his victims. Aston Villa were beaten 3–1 in the game at [[Old Trafford]].<ref>{{Cite news |title=Man Utd 3–1 Aston Villa|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/6236709.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=13 January 2007 |accessdate=17 August 2008 |first=Phil |last=McNulty }}</ref> Agbonlahor then scored deep into injury time in the following game, against [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] on 20 January, to end a Villa winless run that stretched back to 11 November.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Aston Villa 2–0 Watford |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/6258655.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 January 2007 |accessdate=17 August 2008 |first=Mandeep |last=Sanghera }}</ref>

Agbonlahor had played every minute of Aston Villa's campaign in 2006–07, until he was replaced by [[Patrik Berger]], in the 2–0 away fixture against [[Reading FC|Reading]], on 10 February 2007. The following match was the first of the season that Agbonlahor did not start—he instead appeared from the bench, replacing new Villa signing [[Shaun Maloney]]. Manager Martin O'Neill suggested that Agbonlahor, who had been playing out of position on the right wing for much of the season, had done superbly, and being dropped from the first 11 was in order to rest him, and alleviate growing crowd pressure.{{citation needed|date=September 2011}}

Following this break, Agbonlahor went on a scoring spree. He scored from the right-wing against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] on 2 April, to gain Villa a valuable point.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Aston Villa 1–1 Everton |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/6491145.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=2 April 2007 |accessdate=17 August 2008 |first=Chris |last=Bevan }}</ref> Following this match, Agbonlahor signed a new-four-year contract at Aston Villa.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Agbonlahor signs new Villa deal |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/a/aston_villa/6517409.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=3 April 2007 |accessdate=17 August 2008 }}</ref> The following Saturday, in the absence of [[John Carew]], he was moved back to his natural position at centre forward and again found his name on the scoresheet.

Agbonlahor made it three in a row on [[Easter Monday]], again scoring an equaliser, adjudged to have crossed the line by assistant referee Dave Richardson.

===2007–08 season===
Agbonlahor also scored the vital second goal in the match between Aston Villa and Chelsea on 2 September, in which Villa won 2–0.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Aston Villa 2–0 Chelsea |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/6963719.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=2 September 2007 |accessdate=2 September 2007 |first=Andrew |last=McKenzie }}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/sport/football/article262239.ece |title=Aston Villa 2 Chelsea 0 |newspaper=[[The Sun (newspaper)|The Sun]] |date=3 September 2007 |accessdate=3 September 2007 |location=London |first=Janine |last=Self }}</ref> Agbonlahor scored the winning goal in the 86th minute of the [[Second City derby]], 60 seconds after saving the ball on the line from a [[Liam Ridgewell]] shot. After 13 games, Agbonlahor was the club's top goal scorer, with six Premier League goals. On 7 December it was announced that Agbonlahor had won the Premier League Player of the Month award and manager [[Martin O'Neill]] had won the Manager of the Month award for the same month.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Villa claim maiden Barclays Awards double |url=http://www.premierleague.com/staticFiles/4d/c4/0,,12306~115789,00.pdf |publisher=Premier League |date=7 December 2007 |accessdate=18 August 2008 |format=PDF }}</ref>

On 12 April 2008, Agbonlahor scored the fourth goal against [[Derby County F.C.|Derby County]] in a 6–0 victory at [[Pride Park Stadium|Pride Park]] in the Premier League.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Derby 0–6 Aston Villa |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/7332038.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=12 April 2008 |accessdate=17 August 2008 |first=Chris |last=Whyatt }}</ref> In the [[Birmingham derby]] on 20 April 2008, he scored the fifth and final goal in the 5–1 victory.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Aston Villa 5–1 Birmingham |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/7344139.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 April 2008 |accessdate=17 August 2008 |first=Phil |last=Harlow }}</ref>

===2008–09 season===
On 15 August 2008, Agbonlahor signed a new four-year contract with Aston Villa, tying him to the club until 2012.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Agbonlahor commits to Villains |url=http://www.premierleague.com/page/Headlines/0,,12306~1366836,00.html |publisher=[[Premier League]] |date=15 August 2008 |accessdate=17 August 2008 }}</ref>

Following his contract extension, on 17 August 2008, Agbonlahor scored a "perfect" [[hat-trick]] (scoring goals with his head, right foot and left foot) against [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] in Villa's opening game of the [[2008–09 Premier League|2008–09 season]] at Villa Park. The three goals were netted in the space of seven minutes, making it the second-fastest hat-trick in the history of the Premier League. He was later named [[man of the match]] for this performance, which led to a 4–2 victory.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Aston Villa 4–2 Man City |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/7551172.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 August 2008 |accessdate=17 August 2008 |first=Chris |last=Bevan }}</ref>
[[File:Gabriel Agbonlahor Aston Villa-FH 318.jpg|right|275px|thumb|Agbonahor playing for Aston Villa in 2008.]]
Early in the season he began to form a successful strike partnership with team-mate [[John Carew]], this demonstrated in the Premier League away games against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]]<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/7613928.stm |title=West Brom 1–2 Aston Villa |date=21 September 2008 |accessdate=30 December 2008 |publisher=BBC Sport |first=David |last=McIntyre}}</ref> and [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]]<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/7674189.stm |title=Wigan 0–4 Aston Villa |date=26 October 2008 |accessdate=30 December 2008 |publisher=BBC Sport |first=Phil |last=Dawkes }}</ref> where both players scored in both games and provided assists. On 3 November, Agbonlahor was at the centre of a controversy with [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]]'s [[Joey Barton]] when, during the match, Barton appeared to brush his fingers on Agbonlahor's face. It later emerged that Barton's attack might have been race-orientated but, after careful consideration by both Aston Villa and the FA, no further action was taken.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/7684775.stm |title=Newcastle 2–0 Aston Villa |date=3 November 2008 |accessdate=5 November 2008 |publisher=BBC Sport }}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/n/newcastle_united/7707627.stm |title=FA decides not to punish Barton |date=4 November 2008 |accessdate=5 November 2008 |publisher=BBC Sport }}</ref> On 8 November, it emerged in some national newspapers that the reason Agbonlahor decided not to pursue legal action against Barton was because he "felt sorry" for him.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/football/2008/nov/05/astonvilla-newcastleunited-barton-agbonlahor |title=No Barton complaint from Agbonlahor following racism allegations |date=5 November 2008 |accessdate=30 December 2008 |newspaper=[[The Guardian]] |location=London |first=Paul |last=Doyle }}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.mirror.co.uk/sport-old/football/2008/11/07/gabriel-agbonlahor-exclusive-why-i-let-joey-barton-get-away-with-loutish-behaviour-115875-20877584/ |title=Gabriel Agbonlahor exclusive: Why I let Joey Barton get away with loutish behaviour |date=7 November 2008 |accessdate=30 December 2008 |newspaper=[[Daily Mirror]] }}</ref> On 15 November, he scored once and played a part in the other goal, when Aston Villa beat [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] 2–0 at the [[Emirates Stadium]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/7731794.stm |title=Arsenal 0–2 Aston Villa |date=15 November 2008 |accessdate=30 December 2008 |publisher=BBC Sport |first=Phil |last=McNulty }}</ref> He scored a brace against [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]] on 13 December.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/7763479.stm |title=Aston Villa 4–2 Bolton |date=13 December 2008 |accessdate=30 December 2008 |publisher=BBC Sport |first=Caroline |last=Cheese }}</ref> Agbonlahor notched his tenth league goal of the season in the 90th minute in a 2–0 win against [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]] on 7 February.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/7867070.stm |title=Blackburn 0–2 Aston Villa |date=7 February 2009 |accessdate=15 February 2009 |publisher=BBC Sport |first=Mandeep |last=Sanghera }}</ref>

However, this was a high point in a dismal run of form in which he scored just 1 goal in 12 league games. Some fans began to get frustrated with Agbonlahor and in Villa's home defeat against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] there were some sarcastic cheers as he was substituted off by Martin O'Neill.{{citation needed|date=September 2011}} He was subsequently dropped to the bench for Villa's next game away to [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] which Villa lost 5–0. After the heavy defeat to Liverpool and despite his lack of form Agbonlahor was recalled to the starting 11 and went on to score a goal against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] on 5 April in a 3–2 defeat for Villa. Agbonlahor was nominated for the [[PFA Young Player of the Year]] with team mate [[Ashley Young]] winning the honour.

===2009–10 season===
Agbonlahor's first goal of the [[2009-10 Premier League|2009–10 season]] came in a 2–0 home victory over [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] on 30 August 2009. The striker brought the ball from the centre of the field to strike, left-footed, past [[Mark Schwarzer]] from around 20 yards out.

The striker scored the only goal in the season's opening Birmingham derby against [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham]], netting an open header past [[Joe Hart]] as a result of a free kick taken by Ashley Young. Agbonlahor scored his third goal of the season scoring in a 2–0 win against [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Agbonlahor helps sink Portsmouth to another defeat |url=http://soccernet-assets.espn.go.com/match?id=269907&cc=5739 |publisher=[[ESPNsoccernet]] |date=19 September 2009 |accessdate=19 September 2009 }}</ref> He scored his fourth and fifth consecutive goals of the season against [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] in the [[2009–10 Football League Cup|League Cup]] and [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]] in the Premier League. His next goal came on 24 October 2009 against [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] at [[Molineux Stadium|Molineux]] in the Premier League. Fellow Villa forward [[Emile Heskey]] played the ball into the penalty area where Agbonlahor turned a defender and placed a low shot past Wolves goalkeeper [[Wayne Hennessey]]. The game finished 2–1.

He scored the only goal in the 1–0 win against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] at [[Old Trafford]], heading in a cross from [[Ashley Young]] after 21 minutes, providing Villa's first league win at Old Trafford since 1983. Agbonlahor scored in the second leg of the League Cup semi-final against Blackburn Rovers helping Villa to get to the [[2010 Football League Cup Final|final]] where they lost to Manchester United 2–1. He scored twice in 2–0 win at [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] on 30 January 2010. On 21 February, Agbonlahor provided an assist for Emile Heskey before adding Villa's final goal in a 5–2 victory over [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] for his 11th league goal of the season.

Agbonlahor finished the season with thirteen goals in the Premier League, and 16 in all competitions.

===2010–11 season===
Despite Villa suffering some issues on and off the field at the beginning of the season such as the resignation of manager Martin O'Neill and a humiliating 6–0 defeat at the hands of [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]], Agbonlahor defended the club and stated his intent to remain there for the long term.<ref name="skysports.com">{{cite web |url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,11677_6343071,00.html |title=Agbonlahor plans Villa stay |publisher=[[Sky Sports]] |date=28 August 2010 }}</ref>

Agbonlahor signed a new four-and-a-half-year contract on 12 November 2010 keeping him at [[Villa Park]] until at least 2015.
On 16 January 2011, he made his 200th appearance in an Aston Villa shirt in a 1–1 draw with rivals [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham City]], playing the full 90 minutes at [[St Andrew's (stadium)|St. Andrews]]. Agbonlahor scored his first goal in the Premier League since April 2010 in the 2–1 victory over [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] on 26 January 2011 at the [[DW Stadium]]. On 16 April 2011 Agbonlahor scored an injury-time winner away at [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham]].<ref>{{Cite news |title=West Ham 1–2 Aston Villa |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/eng_prem/9455649.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 April 2011 |accessdate=16 September 2011 }}</ref>

Agbonlahor was less prolific in terms of goalscoring during 2010–11 due to Aston Villa manager [[Gérard Houllier]] preferring to use him as a winger.<ref>{{cite web |title=Aston Villa: Gabby Agbonlahor prepared to keep playing on left wing |url=http://www.birminghammail.net/birmingham-sport/aston-villa-fc/aston-villa-news/2011/01/18/aston-villa-gabby-agbonlahor-prepared-to-keep-playing-on-left-wing-97319-28003748/ |publisher=[[Birmingham Mail]] |date=18 January 2011 }}</ref>

===2011–12 season===
Agbonlahor scored his first goal of the [[2011–12 Premier League|2011–12 season]] in Aston Villa's 3–1 home win over [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]] on 20 August 2011, and followed this up with the leveller in a 2–2 away draw against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] 10 days later.<ref>{{cite news | title = Aston Villa 3–1 Blackburn Rovers | url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/14514645.stm |publisher=BBC | accessdate =8 October 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news | title = Everton 2–2 Aston Villa | url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/14773325.stm |publisher=BBC | accessdate =8 October 2011}}</ref> For his positive performances during the opening month of the season, Agbonlahor was named as Aston Villa's player of the month for August 2011, beating off competition from [[Fabian Delph]] to the top spot.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.avfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10265~2451517,00.html |title=Agbonlahor confirmed as August player of the month &#124; Aston Villa |publisher=Avfc.co.uk }}</ref> He then made it 3 goals in 3 games when he scored in a 1–1 home draw against [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] on 17 September.<ref>{{cite news | title = Aston Villa 1–1 | url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/14864217.stm |publisher=BBC | accessdate =8 October 2011}}</ref> This meant that Agbonlahor had equalled his Premier League goals tally from 2010–11 after just five games into the new season.

After rediscovering his goalscoring form under new boss [[Alex McLeish]], the striker publicly spoke of his discontent at the managerial tenure of [[Gérard Houllier]] and his assistant [[Gary McAllister]] and said that he even considered quitting the club had the previous regime remained.<ref>{{cite web|author=Eurosport |url=http://uk.eurosport.yahoo.com/16092011/58/premier-league-agbonlahor-houllier-killed.html |title=Premier League&nbsp;– Agbonlahor: Houllier 'killed' me&nbsp;– Yahoo! Eurosport |publisher=Uk.eurosport.yahoo.com }}</ref> Meanwhile on the pitch Agbonlahor continued to impress, scoring the first goal and setting up [[Darren Bent]] for the second in a [[man of the match]] performance against [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] on 1 October.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.avfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10265~2469378,00.html |title=Match report: Villa 2–0 Wigan &#124; Aston Villa |publisher=Avfc.co.uk }}</ref> He then put in another man of the match performance against [[Norwich City]] in a 3–2 win, on 5 November, setting up both of [[Darren Bent]]'s goals and scoring the second himself.<ref>{{cite news | title = Aston Villa 3–2 Norwich | url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/15504047.stm |publisher=BBC | date = 5 November 2011| accessdate =8 November 2011}}</ref> On 7 January 2012 he scored the second goal in a 3–1 win against [[Bristol Rovers F.C.|Bristol Rovers]] in the third round of the [[FA Cup]] after [[Marc Albrighton]] had given Villa the lead.<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/fa_cup/16372066.stm "Bristol Rovers-Aston Villa"] BBC Sport. 7 January 2012. Retrieved 15 January 2012.</ref> On 3 April 2012, after Aston Villa captain Stilyan Petrov's diagnosis with acute leukaemia, Agbonlahor was named team captain upon Petrov's diagnosis.

===2012–13 season===
Following the sacking of [[Alex McLeish]] in the summer of 2012, Agbonlahor was not chosen as interim captain by McLeish's successor, [[Paul Lambert]]. The Scotsman opted firstly for [[Darren Bent]] as skipper, before choosing new signing [[Ron Vlaar]] to wear the captain's armband in the absence of Stiliyan Petrov.

Agbonlahor began the season injured, and could not make an appearance until the 1–1 away draw with [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] on 2 September. He later returned to full fitness and started the away game at [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] on 25 September. Agbonlahor managed to score two goals in the match as Aston Villa secured a memorable 4–2 [[Football League Cup|League Cup]] win (after extra time) over the Premier League champions at the [[City of Manchester Stadium|Etihad Stadium]]. On 3 November 2012 he scored his first Premier League goal in just under a year against [[Sunderland AFC|Sunderland]] in a run stretching 29 games. On 6 April 2013, Agbonlahor scored his 60th Premier League goal for Aston Villa making him joint top Premier League goalscorer for the club alongside [[Dwight Yorke]]. On 29 April in a 6–1 win over Sunderland Agbonlahor scored his 61st Premier League goal to overtake Yorke as Villa's highest all-time Premier League goal scorer. He scored two goals  in a 1–2 win over [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]] on 4 May, moving Aston Villa up to 13th place in the Premier League.

===2013–14 season===
Agbonlahor began the season brightly, winning two penalties in a 1–3 win over [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] on 17 August 2013 and again assisting [[Benteke]]'s goal against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] four days later in a controversial 2–1 defeat at [[Stamford Bridge (stadium)|Stamford Bridge]]. This resulted in strong praise from manager [[Paul Lambert]], and a huge demand from the public for an England call up, which was ignored by [[Roy Hodgson]].

In September, Agbonlahor participated in a charity match organised by [[Stiliyan Petrov]], which featured many celebrities and footballers, both former and current. During the match, Agbonlahor tackled and injured [[One Direction]] member [[Louis Tomlinson]], who then became ill after being substituted. Despite apologising to Tomlinson, Agbonlahor received many threats after the match from One Direction fans via [[Twitter]].<ref>http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/24014589</ref>

===2014–15 season===
[[File:Chelsea 3 Aston Villa 0 (15349351786).jpg|thumb|Agbonlahor playing against Chelsea in September 2014, finding space around [[John Terry]], [[César Azpilicueta]] and [[Gary Cahill]]]]
On 10 September 2014, Agbonlahor signed a new four-year contract, saying "I can still remember making my debut, so to still be able to contribute is a great feeling."<ref>{{cite news|title=Gabriel Agbonlahor signs new four-year Aston Villa contract|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29149659|accessdate=10 September 2014|work=BBC Sport|date=1 September 2014}}</ref> Three days later, he scored the only goal as Villa won away at Liverpool, a club he had only scored once against before in the Premier League.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Bevan|first1=Chris|title=Liverpool 0-1 Aston Villa|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29090587|accessdate=13 September 2014|work=BBC Sport|date=13 September 2014}}</ref>

He was given a straight red card on 20 December for a challenge on former teammate [[Ashley Young]] as Villa drew 1–1 with Manchester United,<ref>{{cite news|last1=Reddy|first1=Luke|title=Aston Villa 1-1 Man Utd|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30459793|accessdate=27 December 2014|work=BBC Sport|date=20 December 2014}}</ref> however his three-match suspension was rescinded on appeal three days later.<ref>{{cite news|title=Gabriel Agbonlahor: Aston Villa forward's red card appeal successful|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30592764|accessdate=27 December 2014|work=BBC Sport|date=23 December 2014}}</ref>

Agbonlahor made his 300th Premier League appearance for Villa on 14 March 2015 away to Sunderland, scoring twice in the first half in a 4&ndash;0 win.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Kendrick|first1=Mat|title=Aston Villa: Tim Sherwood backs Gabriel Agbonlahor to keep firing|url=http://www.birminghammail.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/aston-villa-tim-sherwood-backs-8831576|accessdate=14 March 2015|work=Birmingham Mail|date=14 March 2015}}</ref>

==International career==
Agbonlahor's ancestry qualifies him to play for [[Scotland national football team|Scotland]] or [[Nigeria national football team|Nigeria]] at international level, but he chose to play for his homeland of [[England national football team|England]].

On 20 September 2006, Agbonlahor was pencilled in as a player in the [[Nigeria national under-20 football team|Nigeria U-20]] team for the match against [[Rwanda]]. He turned down the call, whilst not ruling out playing for the country in the future,<ref>{{Cite news |title=Agbonlahor turns down Nigeria |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/africa/5375596.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 September 2006 |accessdate=5 September 2007 }}</ref> but subsequently pledged his future to England.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.thepatrioticvanguard.com/article.php3?id_article=822 |title=Nigeria, England, Scotland battle for whiz kid |newspaper=The Patriotic Vanguard |date=9 October 2006 |accessdate=11 January 2009 }}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |title=Gab: England for Me |url=http://www.avfc.premiumtv.co.uk/page/News/HeadlinesDetail/0,,10265~1109003,00.html |publisher=[[Aston Villa F.C.]] |date=11 September 2007 |accessdate=11 September 2007 }}</ref>

On 28 September 2006, Agbonlahor received his first call-up to the [[England national under-21 football team|England U-21 squad]], and won his first U21 cap as a substitute against [[Germany national under-21 football team|Germany]] on 6 October. Agbonlahor was then omitted from the England's [[UEFA U-21 Championship 2007|U-21 Championship]] squad, by manager [[Stuart Pearce]], on 30 May 2007, as a result of missing the England U21 training camp in Spain. [[David Bentley]], also included in the [[England national football team|England first team]] line-up, took his place.

Agbonlahor was later recalled to the side by Pearce, in September 2007,<ref>{{Cite news |title=Agbonlahor in England U21 squad |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/internationals/6949403.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 August 2006 |accessdate=5 September 2007 }}</ref> netting his first goal for the under-21s, by scoring the second in a 3–0 victory, over [[Montenegro national under-21 football team|Montenegro U-21]].

On 1 February, Agbonlahor was named in [[Fabio Capello]]'s 23-man England squad to play [[Switzerland national football team|Switzerland]] in February 2008,<ref>{{Cite news |title=Capello keeps Agbonlahor in squad |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/internationals/7224293.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=2 February 2008 |accessdate=30 December 2008 }}</ref> although a hamstring injury forced him to withdraw from the game.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Wright-Phillips fit for England |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/internationals/7225317.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 February 2008 |accessdate=30 December 2008 }}</ref> Agbonlahor was also an unused substitute in England's respective 2–0 and 3–0 friendly victories against the [[United States men's national soccer team|United States]]<ref>{{Cite news |title=England 2–0 USA |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/internationals/7420122.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 May 2008 |accessdate=30 December 2008 |first=Andrew |last=McKenzie }}</ref> and [[Trinidad and Tobago national football team|Trinidad & Tobago]]<ref>{{Cite news |title=England 3–0 Trinidad & Tobago |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/internationals/7425208.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 June 2008 |accessdate=30 December 2008 }}</ref> in May–June 2008.

On 15 November 2008, he was called up to Capello's squad for the upcoming match against [[Germany national football team|Germany]] in [[Olympic Stadium (Berlin)|Berlin]], joining three other Aston Villa players in the squad: [[Ashley Young]], [[Curtis Davies]] and [[Gareth Barry]]. On 19 November, he was named to start against [[Germany national football team|Germany]]. He played for 76 minutes,<ref>{{Cite news |title=Germany 1–2 England |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/internationals/7737012.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=19 November 2008 |accessdate=16 September 2011 |first=Andrew |last=McKenzie }}</ref> had a goal disallowed and received high praise from [[John Terry]], the latter describing him as "a nightmare to play against".<ref>{{Cite news |title=Aston Villa's Agbonlahor and Young impress England captain Terry |url=http://www.birminghammail.net/birmingham-sport/aston-villa-fc/aston-villa-news/2008/11/19/aston-villa-s-agbonlahor-and-young-impress-england-captain-terry-97319-22293018/ |newspaper=[[Birmingham Mail]] |date=19 November 2008 |accessdate=30 December 2008 }}</ref>

On 11 February 2009 he was in the starting line up against [[Spain national football team|Spain]], where he played for 75 minutes before being substituted for debutant [[Carlton Cole]].<ref>{{Cite news |title=Spain 2–0 England |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/internationals/7874902.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 February 2009 |accessdate=16 September 2011 |first=Mandeep |last=Sanghera }}</ref> He made his first appearance in a competitive international on 14 October 2009, playing 66 minutes in the 3–0 win over [[Belarus national football team|Belarus]] in the last game of [[2010 FIFA World Cup qualification|qualification]] for the [[2010 FIFA World Cup|2010 World Cup]].<ref>{{Cite news |title=England 3–0 Belarus |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/internationals/8301471.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 October 2009 |accessdate=16 September 2011 |first=Phil |last=McNulty }}</ref> He was last called up to the squad in November 2011.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Agbonlahor: "I'd love to play for England again but Villa come first." |url=http://www.birminghammail.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/gabby-agbonlahor-id-love-play-3412768 |publisher=Birmingham Mail |date=5 May 2013 |accessdate=11 November 2013 |first=Mat |last=Kendrick }}</ref>

==Personal life==
Agbonlahor was one of four children born to a Nigerian father and a Scottish mother in Birmingham. However his parents separated while he was still young and he lived with his father, without any contact with his mother for around 20 years. In 2009, ahead of the striker's 23rd birthday, his mother made a public appeal to him via the city's ''[[Sunday Mercury]]'' newspaper, in order to become part of his life once more.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sundaymercury.net/video-pics/midlands-birmingham-videos/2009/10/09/mother-of-aston-villa-striker-agbonlahor-pleads-to-her-son-66331-24893640/ |title=Mother of Aston Villa striker Agbonlahor pleads to her son |publisher=Sunday Mercury }} {{dead link|date=May 2013}}</ref> Agbonlahor later contacted his mother and the pair reconciled.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sundaymercury.net/news/midlands-news/2009/10/18/aston-villa-star-gabby-agbonlahor-in-phone-call-to-estranged-mum-66331-24954733/2/ |title=Aston Villa star Gabby Agbonlahor in phone call to estranged mum |publisher=Sunday Mercury }} {{dead link|date=May 2013}}</ref>
