'''Sergio Leonel "Kun" Agüero Del Castillo''' ({{IPA-es|ˈserxjo aˈɣweɾo}}; born 2 June 1988) is an Argentine professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)#Striker|striker]] for [[Premier League]] club [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] and the [[Argentina national football team|Argentina national team]]. On 5 July 2003, he became the youngest player to debut in the [[Argentine Primera División]] at 15 years and 35 days, breaking the record previously established by [[Diego Maradona]] in [[Seasons in Argentine football|1976]].<ref>{{Cite news |title=The rise of Sergio Aguero |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/europe/7384547.stm |work=BBC Sport |date=7 May 2008}}</ref> He plays with the shirt name '''Kun Agüero'''.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Yes you Kun! New City star Aguero told he can use nickname on his shirt |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2027348/Sergio-Aguero-use-Kun-Manchester-City-shirt.html |newspaper=Daily Mail |date=18 August 2011 |accessdate=15 May 2012 |location=London}}</ref>

At international level, Agüero represented the [[Argentina national under-20 football team|Argentina under-20 team]] at the [[FIFA U-20 World Cup]] in [[2005 FIFA World Youth Championship|2005]] and in [[2007 FIFA U-20 World Cup|2007]], winning both tournaments. Agüero played at the [[Football at the 2008 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament|2008 Beijing Olympics]], he scored two goals in the 3–0 semi-final win against [[Brazil national under-23 football team|Brazil]] as Argentina went on to win the gold medal.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.independent.co.uk/sport/olympics/argentina-3-brazil-0-argentina-in-final-after-routing-arch-rivals-902777.html |title=Argentina 3 Brazil 0: Argentina in final after routing arch rivals – Olympics, Sport |publisher=The Independent |date=20 August 2008 |accessdate=24 August 2011 |location=London |first1=Nick |last1=Harris}}</ref> Agüero was selected to represent Argentina in the [[2010 FIFA World Cup]], [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] and the [[2011 Copa América]].<ref name=rise/>

In 2006, Agüero moved to Europe to play for [[La Liga]] side [[Atlético Madrid]] for a fee of €23 million from [[Club Atlético Independiente|Independiente]]. He made a name for himself, attracting attention from Europe's top clubs by scoring 101 goals in 234 appearances while winning the [[UEFA Europa League]] and the [[UEFA Super Cup]] in 2010. Agüero moved to [[Premier League]] club [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] in July 2011 for [[List of most expensive association football transfers|an undisclosed fee thought to be in the region of £35 million]].<ref name="telegraph">{{Cite news |title=Sergio Aguero completes £35 million transfer to Manchester City|url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/manchester-city/8669009/Sergio-Aguero-completes-35-million-transfer-to-Manchester-City.html |newspaper=Daily Telegraph |date=28 July 2011 |location=London |first=Luke |last=Edwards}}</ref><ref name="indep">{{Cite news |title=Manchester City move 'felt right' says Sergio Aguero |url=http://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/manchester-city-move-felt-right-says-sergio-aguero-2328171.html |newspaper=Independent |date=29 July 2011 |location=London |first1=Carl |last1=Markham}}</ref> On the last day of his debut season with the club, Agüero scored a 94th-minute winner against [[Queen's Park Rangers]] that earned [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] its first league title in 44 years.<ref name="BBC2012"/> In 2012, he won [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]]'s player of the year as voted for by the fans. As of the end of the 2013–14 season, Agüero has the highest goals per minute ratio in the history of the [[Premier League]] averaging a goal every 115 minutes.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Top 10 All-Time Premier League Strikers Based On Minutes Per Goal Record: Man City Star Edges Out Arsenal Legend |url=http://www.caughtoffside.com/2014/05/05/top-10-all-time-premier-league-strikers-based-on-minutes-per-goal-record-man-city-star-edges-out-arsenal-legend/9/ |work=caughtoffside.com |date=5 May 2014 |accessdate=2014-08-19}}</ref>

==Club career==

===Independiente===
Sergio Agüero joined the youth system of [[Club Atlético Independiente|Independiente]] at the age of nine. He started playing for the side, becoming the youngest player to debut in the division at 15 years and 35 days (on 5 July 2003 against [[Club Atlético San Lorenzo de Almagro]]), when Independiente's coach, [[Oscar Ruggeri]] sent Agüero onto the field as a substitute for [[Emanuel Benito Rivas|Emanuel Rivas]] in the 69th minute of the match.<ref name=rise>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/europe/7384547.stm|title=The Rise of Sergio Aguero|publisher=BBC Sport|date=7 May 2008|accessdate=25 March 2009}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.elpais.com/articulo/deportes/23/millones/menor/edad/elpepidep/20060601elpepidep_1/Tes |title=23 millones por un menor de edad |publisher=Elpais.com |date=1 June 2006 |accessdate=15 May 2012}}</ref> His performance was well received by the press,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://edant.clarin.com/diario/2003/07/06/d-06215.htm |title=San Lorenzo, de la galera |publisher=Edant.clarin.com |date= |accessdate=15 May 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://old.ole.com.ar/diario/2003/07/06/c-585306.htm |title=Diario Deportivo Olé – Pájaro de buen Agüero |publisher=Old.ole.com.ar |date= |accessdate=15 May 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/509319-muy-frio-san-lorenzo-gano-un-clasico-pobre |title=Muy frío: San Lorenzo ganó un clásico pobre – 06.07.2003 |publisher=Lanacion.com.ar |date= |accessdate=15 May 2012}}</ref> Despite his early debut, Agüero was not selected again by Ruggeri, and his replacement [[Osvaldo Sosa]], for the remainder of [[2002–03 Argentine Primera División|2002–03 season]], having only made just one appearance in the [[2002–03 in Argentine football|Torneo Clausura]]. Following the arrival of coach [[Jose Omar Pastoriza]], seven months after Agüero's first match he returned to the club's first-team in 4–2 win against [[Peru|Peru's]] [[Cienciano]] during the group stages of the [[2004 Copa Libertadores]]. This meant that Agüero also became the youngest player to participate in the [[Copa Libertadores]], a record that he held for three years.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cronica.com.mx/nota.php?id_nota=341620 |title=La Crónica de Hoy &#124; Prematuro debut, ¿el prólogo de una gran carrera? |publisher=Cronica.com.mx |date=10 January 2008 |accessdate=15 May 2012}}</ref> One month later, Agüero again featured in a Copa Libertadores fixture against [[Ecuador|Ecuador's]] [[Club Deportivo El Nacional|El Nacional]]. On 19 June, for the first time, Agüero played a full 90-minute match for Independiente against [[Atlético de Rafaela]] during the [[2003–04 Argentine Primera División|Torneo Clausura]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.terra.com.ar/ctematicos/clausura2004/partido/2388.shtml |title=Deportes " Torneo Clausura 2004 |publisher=Terra |date= |accessdate=15 May 2012}}</ref> He scored his first goal for Independiente in a 2–2 draw against [[Estudiantes de la Plata|Estudiantes]] on 26 November, with a 22nd minute shot from outside the penalty area.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.terra.com.ar/ctematicos/apertura2004/partido/2661.shtml |title=Deportes " Torneo Clausura 2004 |publisher=Terra |date=26 November 2004 |accessdate=15 May 2012}}</ref><ref name="bio">{{cite news|url=http://www.abcpedia.com/deporte/sergio-kun-aguero.html|title=Biografia (Spanish)|accessdate=20 November 2010}}</ref> Agüero became a regular in the club's first-team, being selected for the [[Argentina national under-20 football team|Argentina U-20 squad]] for the [[2005 FIFA World Youth Championship|2005 FIFA U-20 World Cup]], which Argentina won.

During the [[2005–06 in Argentine football|2005–06 season]], Agüero scored 18 goals in 36 league appearances, having missed two games due to suspension. In a 4–0 win against [[Racing Club de Avellaneda|Racing]] on 11 September, Agüero dribbled from inside of his own half and scored Independiente's fourth goal with a left footed shot.<ref name=bio /><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.independiente1905.com.ar/noticias/noti_29.htm |title=Sergio Agüero, El Demonio Rojo |publisher=Independiente1905.com.ar |date=13 September 2005 |accessdate=15 May 2012}}</ref> His first red card came in the Torneo Apertura, after slapping an opponent in a match against [[Tiro Federal]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.terra.com.ar/canales/apertura05/partido/2987.shtml |title=Deportes > Torneo apertura 2005 |publisher=Terra |date= |accessdate=15 May 2012}}</ref> His outstanding performances during the [[2005–06 Argentine Primera División|Torneo Apertura]] attracted interest from a number of big name European clubs, and after months of speculation, Agüero announced on TV in April that he intended to leave the club at the end of the season. Before the end of the season, there had already been speculation of a possible transfer to [[Atlético Madrid]].<ref name=bio /> With his performances being lauded by the press, there was talk of a possible call up for Agüero for the [[2006 FIFA World Cup]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://espndeportes.espn.go.com/news/story?id=427233 |title=Suma goles, suma apoyo popular – Mundial2006 – ESPN Deportes |publisher=Espndeportes.espn.go.com |date=1 January 2008 |accessdate=15 May 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://espndeportes.espn.go.com/news/story?id=443923 |title=Tres nombres que no hubieran faltado – Mundial2006 – ESPN Deportes |publisher=Espndeportes.espn.go.com |date=1 January 2008 |accessdate=12 June 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/788856-aguero-todos-piden-por-el |title=Agüero: todos piden por él – 15.03.2006 |publisher=Lanacion.com.ar |date=15 March 2006 |accessdate=15 May 2012}}</ref> In a 2–0 away victory against [[Olimpo de Bahia Blanca]] in round 17 of the Torneo Clausura, Agüero received his fifth yellow card of the season. This prevented him from playing his last game for Independiente in a fixture against [[Boca Juniors]] in [[Avellaneda]] one week later. The yellow card brought tears to the eyes of Agüero, as television cameras recorded.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.terra.com.ar/canales/clausura06/partido/3356.shtml |title=Deportes > Torneo Clausura 2006 |publisher=Terra |date= |accessdate=15 May 2012}}</ref> Agüero, who scored Independiente's second goal of the match later said "I think that it was my last goal for Independiente". He played his last game for Independiente, two weeks later, in a 2–0 away defeat to [[Rosario Central]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.terra.com.ar/canales/clausura06/partido/3376.shtml |title=Deportes > Torneo Clausura 2006 |publisher=Terra |date= |accessdate=15 May 2012}}</ref> On 30 May, Agüero officially transferred to [[Atlético Madrid]] for [[Euro sign|€]]20 million, marking a record for the [[Bank of Spain]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eluniversal.com.mx/notas/352663.html |title=Agüero, el juvenil récord del futbol argentino – El Universal – Deportes |publisher=El Universal |date= |accessdate=15 May 2012}}</ref>

===Atlético Madrid===
[[File:SergioAgüero.jpg|thumb|left|120px|Agüero playing for Atlético Madrid in October 2007.]]

====2006–07 season====
In May 2006, Agüero joined Spanish club [[Atlético Madrid]] for a fee reported to be around [[Euro sign|€]]23 million, breaking the club's previous transfer record.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/news/story?id=369484&cc=5739|publisher=ESPN Soccernet|title=Atlético agree fee for Independiente starlet}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/news/story?id=369713&cc=4716|publisher=ESPN Soccernet|title=Atlético sign Argentine prodigy Agüero}}</ref> He caused controversy early in his Atlético career by using his hands to score the winning goal against [[Recreativo de Huelva]] on 14 October 2006, only his second goal for the club, with the first coming in a 4–1 away win against [[Athletic Bilbao]] on 17 September.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report?id=204980&cc=null&league=ESP.1|publisher=ESPN|title=Atlético Madrid 2–1 Recreativo Huelva}}</ref> He ended his first season in Madrid with 7 goals in all competitions, eased into European football by manager [[Javier Aguirre]], who opted to bring him in and out of the line-up as Atlético finished seventh – enough to qualify for the [[UEFA Intertoto Cup]].

====2007–08 season====
Following the departure of strike partner [[Fernando Torres]] to [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] in the summer of 2007, Agüero secured his starting spot for the ''Rojiblancos'' and soon became arguably the team's most important player at the age of just 19. In the [[2007–08 La Liga|2007–08 season]], he finished third highest scorer in [[La Liga]], behind [[Daniel Güiza]] and [[Luís Fabiano]], with 19 goals, and was runner up in the ''[[Trofeo Alfredo Di Stéfano]]'' award.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.realmadrid.com/cs/Satellite/en/1202736803447/noticia/Noticia/Raul_wins_the_Di_Stefano_Trophy.htm|publisher=Real Madrid|title=Marca names the Madridista captain the best player of the league}}</ref> Agüero won many plaudits for his [[man of the match]] display against [[FC Barcelona]] in March 2008, scoring twice, assisting a goal, and winning a penalty for Atlético in a 4–2 win.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/football/2008/mar/03/europeanfootball.barcelona|publisher=The Guardian|title=A masterclass from Atlético Madrid's Sergio Agüero dented Barcelona's title hopes and made several Catalan headline-writers look very foolish indeed | location=London|first=Sid|last=Lowe|date=3 March 2008 }}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |title=Sergio Aguero – Readers Q&A |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/europe/7384770.stm |work=BBC Sport |date=7 May 2008}}</ref> He also scored important goals against the likes of [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]], [[Valencia CF]], [[Sevilla FC]], and [[Villarreal CF]] to help Atlético finish fourth and qualify for the [[UEFA Champions League]] for the first time in over ten years.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.soccerway.com/news/2008/May/12/atletico-de-madrid-confirm-return-to-europes-elite|title=Atletico de Madrid confirm return to Europe's elite|date=12 May 2008|work=soccerway.com}}</ref>

[[File:Sergio Agüero.jpg|thumb|right|upright=0.5|Agüero with Atlético Madrid.]]

====2008–09 season====
Agüero was once again a regular goalscorer for Atlético in the [[2008–09 La Liga|2008–09 season]], continuing to establish a lethal partnership with [[Uruguay]]an striker [[Diego Forlán]], also a former Independiente player. On 16 September, he scored his first Champions League goals in a 3–0 away win at [[PSV Eindhoven|PSV]], helping Atlético eventually reach the last 16 of the competition.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/match_facts/0,19762,11065_3059895,00.html|title=PSV Eindhoven 0–3 Atlético Madrid | work=Sky Sports}}</ref> In March 2009, the duo of Forlán and Agüero scored a [[Brace (sports)#In other fields|brace]] each in a 4–3 win over league leaders Barcelona, the latter scoring the winning goal in the final minutes of the match.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2009/SPORT/football/03/01/spain.barcelona/index.html|publisher=CNN|title=Atletico stun Barcelona as Real close up|accessdate=7 June 2009 | date=1 March 2009}}</ref> With the help of more vital goals in a formidable end of the season run-in from his team, Agüero finished in the top ten contenders for the [[Pichichi Trophy]], which was won by his teammate Forlán.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://es.eurosport.yahoo.com/01062009/15/uruguayo-forlan-gano-pichichi-bota-oro.html|publisher=Eurosport|title=El uruguayo Forlán ganó el 'pichichi' y la 'Bota de Oro'|language=Spanish|date=1 June 2009|accessdate=26 June 2009}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref> Atlético finished fourth in the league, qualifying for the following season's [[2009–10 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]].

====2009–10 season====
Despite not being as prolific in front of goal, Agüero had another good season in [[2009–10 La Liga|2009–10]], and was praised for his influential performances as Atlético enjoyed their most successful season in over a decade.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.marca.com/2010/04/07/futbol/equipos/atletico/1270634644.html|title=Quique Sánchez Flores and Diego Forlán prefer Sergio Agüero to Lionel Messi (Spanish)|publisher=Marca|date=7 April 2010|accessdate=18 November 2010}}</ref> On 3 November 2009, he scored twice against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] during a 2–2 draw in the Champions League at the [[Vicente Calderón Stadium|Vicente Calderón]]. Atlético were knocked out of the competition, but went on to reach the final of the [[2009–10 UEFA Europa League]], where Agüero assisted both goals in a 2–1 [[extra time]] win against English club [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://en.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/matches/season=2010/round=2000042/match=2000967/postmatch/report/index.html|title=Forlán double gives Atlético glory|publisher=UEFA|date=12 May 2010|accessdate=30 July 2010}}</ref> He also helped Atlético reach the final of the [[Copa del Rey]], although this time they were not victorious, losing to Sevilla in the [[Camp Nou]] on 19 May.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/european/7741630/Atletico-Madrid-0-Sevilla-2-match-report.html|title=Atlético Madrid 0–2 Sevilla – Match Report|publisher=Telegraph|date=19 May 2010|accessdate=18 November 2010|location=London}}</ref>

On 27 August 2010, Atlético Madrid captured the [[2010 UEFA Super Cup|UEFA Super Cup]] by beating favorites [[F.C. Internazionale Milano|Internazionale]] 2–0. Agüero provided the assist for [[José Antonio Reyes]]' opening goal and then secured the win by scoring the second.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/12/spain/2010/08/27/2090098/atletico-madrid-goal-heroes-jose-antonio-reyes-kun-aguero-praise-|title=Atletico Madrid Goal Heroes José Antonio Reyes & Kun Agüero Praise Team After Inter Win|publisher=Goal.com|date=27 August 2010|accessdate=27 August 2010}}</ref> On 4 January 2011, Atlético Madrid confirmed via their official website that Agüero had signed a new contract with the club, keeping him at the Vicente Calderón until 2014.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,11827_6634899,00.html|title=Agüero agrees Atlético stay|publisher=Sky Sports|date=4 January 2011|accessdate=4 January 2011}}</ref> The following day, he was named as the new [[captain (association football)|vice-captain]] of Atlético, along with strike partner Diego Forlán.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.clubatleticodemadrid.com/Web/noticia/template_noticia/noticia1.php?idnoticia=16703&previo=1|title=Agüero named Atlético vice-captain|publisher=Atlético Madrid Official website|date=5 January 2011|accessdate=5 January 2011}}</ref>

====2010–11 season====
[[File:Pepe y aguero.jpg|thumb|upright=1.0|Agüero with Atlético Madrid during the [[2010–11 La Liga|2010–11 season]].]]
The [[2010–11 La Liga|2010–11 season]] was arguably Agüero's most successful for Atlético, as he scored 20 league goals for the first time in his career. Between March and May 2011, he went on a run of seven consecutive goalscoring appearances, a feat that no other player in Europe could match during the season.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.twitter.com/#!/OptaJose/statuses/66921084271869952|title=Agüero scores in seven consecutive matches|publisher=Opta (Twitter)}}</ref> Agüero's final outing for Atlético came on 21 May against [[RCD Mallorca]], a game in which he reached two [[milestone]]s. In a 4–3 win, he scored his first career [[hat-trick]], the second goal being his 100th for the ''Colchoneros''.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.goal.com/en-us/match/49221/mallorca-vs-atletico-madrid/report|title=RCD Mallorca 3–4 Atlético Madrid|publisher=Goal.com}}</ref> Failure to celebrate any of the goals, however, led to speculation that he would be on his way out of the club.

On 23 May 2011, Agüero announced on his official website that he wanted to move from Atlético Madrid and formally asked to be released from his contract.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.whoateallthepies.tv/transfer_talk/72527/the-time-has-come-sergio-aguero-seeks-atletico-madrid-exit.html |title='The Time Has Come' – Sergio Aguero Asks Atletico Madrid to Tear Up His Contract » Who Ate all the Pies |publisher=Whoateallthepies.tv |date= |accessdate=15 May 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sergioaguero.com/notas.php?ID=298|title=La Hora de Partir (Time to Leave)|publisher=Sergio Agüero Official website|date=23 May 2011|accessdate=29 May 2011}}</ref> Agüero later spoke to [[ESPN]], where he stated that he would "not be returning to Atlético."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.atleticofans.com/8365/aguero-i-will-not-be-returning-to-atletico/ |title=Agüero: "I will not be returning to Atlético" |publisher=Atleticofans.com |date= |accessdate=15 May 2012}}</ref> On the same day that Agüero officially became a [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] player, Atlético hosted a [[2011–12 UEFA Europa League qualifying phase and play-off round|2011–12 Europa League qualifier]] against [[Strømsgodset IF]], where a group of Atlético fans brandished "Agüero, We Hope You Die" banners in a reaction to the striker's £38 million move to City at the Vicente Calderón on 28 July 2011, after he had previously stated his desire to see out his contract with the club just weeks before requesting a transfer.<ref>{{cite web|last=Peck |first=Brooks |url=http://sports.yahoo.com/soccer/blog/dirty-tackle/post/atletico-fans-say-goodbye-to-aguero-by-wishing-death-upon-him?urn=sow-wp3756 |title=Atletico fans say goodbye to Aguero by wishing death upon him |publisher=Sports.yahoo.com |date= |accessdate=15 May 2012}}</ref> Upon his departure, Atlético used the €45 million from Agüero's sale to buy [[Radamel Falcao]] as his replacement.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tribalfootball.com/articles/atletico-madrid-use-aguero-cash-land-porto-star-falcao-1794881 |title=Atletico Madrid to use Aguero cash to land Porto star Falcao |publisher=tribalfootball.com |date= |accessdate=15 May 2012}}</ref>

===Manchester City===

====2011–12 season====
On 28 July 2011, [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] confirmed that Agüero had signed a five-year contract with the club.<ref name="city-aguero">{{cite web|url=http://www.mcfc.co.uk/News/Team-news/2011/July/Sergio-Aguero-signs-for-Manchester-City|title=Sergio Aguero joins Manchester City|date=27 July 2011}}</ref> [[List of most expensive association football transfers|The fee was reported to be in the region of £38 million]] (€45 million).<ref name="telegraph"/><ref name="indep"/><ref>{{Cite news |title=£85m Aguero! Man City complete amazing deal to land Argentina striker|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2019419/Sergio-Aguero-says-joined-Manchester-City.html |newspaper=Daily Mail |date=28 July 2011 |location=London |first=Dominic |last=King}}</ref> He was given the number 16 shirt for his first season at City<ref name="city-aguero"/> and wears the shirt name '''Kun Agüero'''. He was an unused substitute in the [[Dublin Super Cup]] match against [[F.C. Internazionale Milano|Internazionale]] and the [[2011 FA Community Shield]] against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] with manager [[Roberto Mancini]] believing Agüero was not yet fit.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Man City 2–3 Man Utd |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/14420151.stm |newspaper=bbc.co.uk|date=7 August 2011}}</ref> Agüero made his debut for City on 15 August 2011 in a 4–0 Premier League victory over [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]]. Agüero came on as a substitute in the 59th minute, scoring his first goal for the club within nine minutes after a tap-in from a cross from full back [[Micah Richards]]. He then turned provider with an assist after chipping over the oncoming goalkeeper before flicking the ball back into the penalty box and into the path of [[David Silva]] to score. Agüero rounded off his debut by scoring again in injury time with a 30-yard strike.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mcfc.co.uk/News/Match-reports/2011/August/City-v-Swansea-City |title=Man City versus Swansea Premier League match report – Manchester City FC |publisher=Mcfc.co.uk |date=15 August 2011 |accessdate=24 August 2011}}</ref> His 30-minute debut gained rave reviews among football journalists, with some suggesting it was one of the best in English football.<ref>{{Cite news |title=£38million Manchester City striker Sergio Aguero: from the gutter to the stars |quote=IT was one of the most dramatic and brilliant debuts ever seen in English football – and Argentinian superstar Sergio Aguero only played for half an hour. |last=Myall |first=Steve |url=http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/top-stories/2011/08/17/sergio-aguero-38million-man-city-sensation-is-wed-to-maradona-s-daughter-115875-23349966/ |newspaper=Daily Mirror |date=17 August 2011}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |title=Top 20 greatest football debuts |quote=Sergio Aguero's stunning first outing for Manchester City on Monday night – in which he scored two goals and set up another – is undoubtedly one of the best Premier League debuts ever seen. |url=http://uk.eurosport.yahoo.com/the-rundown/article/7677/ |work=uk.eurosport.yahoo.com |date=16 August 2011}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |title=Top 10 debuts in football to rival Manchester City's Sergio Agüero's |last=Wilson |first=Steve |url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/8703840/Top-10-debuts-in-football-to-rival-Manchester-Citys-Sergio-Agueros.html |newspaper=The Telegraph |date=16 August 2011 |location=London}}</ref> City continued their strong start, winning 3–2 away at [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]] with Agüero missing two chances in the penalty box.<ref>{{cite news | url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/14520274.stm|title = Bolton 2–3 Man City| date= 21 August 2011 | accessdate = 29 August 2011 | publisher = BBC Sport}}</ref> On 28 August, Agüero scored his third league goal in Manchester City's 5–1 rout of [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]].<ref>{{cite news | url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/14606056.stm|title = Tottenham 1–5 Man City| date= 28 August 2011 | accessdate = 29 August 2011 | publisher = BBC Sport}}</ref> On his third start for the club, he scored his first [[List of Premier League hat-tricks|Premier League hat-trick]], against [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]].<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/14773043.stm "Man City 3–0 Wigan"] BBC Sport. 10 September 2011. Retrieved 15 January 2012.</ref> On 18 September, he scored twice at [[Craven Cottage]] against [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]], but City were held to a 2–2 draw.<ref>{{cite news | url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/14869932.stm|title = Fulham 2–2 Man City| date= 18 September 2011 | accessdate = 18 September 2011 | publisher = BBC Sport}}</ref> Having been substituted after just 28 minutes due to an injury during a 4–0 win against [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]] on 1 October, Agüero returned to action in a [[2011–12 UEFA Champions League]] group stage fixture, where he came on for [[Nigel de Jong]] on 62 minutes and scored a 93rd minute winner in his side's 2–1 victory against [[Villarreal CF]] on 18 October.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://au.soccerway.com/matches/2011/10/01/england/premier-league/blackburn-rovers-football-club/manchester-city-football-club/1117100/ |title=Blackburn Rovers vs. Manchester City – 1 October 2011 – Soccerway |publisher=Au.soccerway.com |date=1 October 2011 |accessdate=15 May 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://au.soccerway.com/matches/2011/10/18/europe/uefa-champions-league/manchester-city-football-club/villarreal-club-de-futbol/1209465/ |title=Manchester City vs. Villarreal – 18 October 2011 – Soccerway |publisher=Au.soccerway.com |date=18 October 2011 |accessdate=12 June 2012}}</ref> On 23 October, Agüero took part in his first [[Manchester derby]], scoring in the 69th minute as he converted a Micah Richards pass across the face of goal. The match finished 6–1 to City.<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/15325536.stm "Man Utd 1–6 Man City"] BBC Sport. 23 October 2011. Retrieved 15 January 2012.</ref>
On 1 November, Agüero was shortlisted for the prestigious [[FIFA Ballon d'Or]]. On 19 November, he scored a penalty in a 3–1 win at home to [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]], ending Newcastle's unbeaten start to the season.<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/15704837.stm "Man City 3–1 Newcastle"] BBC Sport. 19 November 2011. Retrieved 15 January 2012.</ref>

[[File:Nasri & Aguero with trophy.JPG|thumb|Agüero (right) and [[Samir Nasri]] parade the Premier League trophy, May 2012.]]
Agüero made his [[Football League Cup|League Cup]] debut in the quarter final match against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] at the [[Emirates Stadium]], scoring the only goal of the game in the 83rd minute from an [[Adam Johnson (footballer)|Adam Johnson]] through-ball.<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/15832027.stm "Arsenal 0–1 Man City"] BBC Sport. 29 November 2011. Retrieved 15 January 2012.</ref> His next goal came in a 5–1 home win against [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]], opening the scoring in the 32nd minute, giving him his 13th goal of the season and maintaining the team's 100% league record at home.<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/15901844.stm "Man City 5–1 Norwich"] BBC Sport. 3 December 2011. Retrieved 15 January 2012.</ref> On 21 December, he scored a brace as City beat [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] 3–0 at home.<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/16173173.stm "Man City 3–0 Stoke"] BBC Sport. 21 December 2011. Retrieved 15 January 2012.</ref> On 3 January 2012, he opened the scoring in a 3–0 win at home to [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]], beating [[Pepe Reina]] with a low shot.<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/16336904.stm "Man City 3–0 Liverpool"] BBC Sport. 3 December 2012. Retrieved 15 January 2012.</ref> Agüero scored his 15th goal on 4 February, scoring a penalty against [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] in a 3–0 win at a snow-covered [[City of Manchester Stadium]]. During the first-leg of a Europa League round of 32 match against [[F.C. Porto|FC Porto]], Agüero entered the field in the 78th minute for [[Mario Balotelli]] and scored the match-winning goal, and his first [[UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] goal for Manchester City, in the 85th minute.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2012/matches/round=2000273/match=2007420/postmatch/lineups/index.html |title=UEFA Europa League 2011/12 – History – Porto-Man. City – |publisher=Uefa.com |date= |accessdate=12 June 2012}}</ref> The game ended 2–1, and, in the second-leg, Agüero scored within 19 seconds in a 4–0 win on 22 February. Manchester City advanced to the [[2011–12 UEFA Europa League knockout phase#Round of 16|last 16]] of the [[2011–12 UEFA Europa League]], having won 6–1 on aggregate. On 25 February, Agüero scored his 16th league goal in a 3–0 win against [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/match/60479/manchester-city-fc-vs-blackburn-rovers/report |title=Match Report: Man City 3–0 Blackburn |publisher=Goal.com |date=25 February 2012 |accessdate=12 June 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.soccerway.com/matches/2012/02/25/england/premier-league/manchester-city-football-club/blackburn-rovers-football-club/1117292/ |title=Manchester City vs. Blackburn Rovers – 25 February 2012 |publisher=Soccerway |date=25 February 2012 |accessdate=12 June 2012}}</ref> During the second-leg of Manchester City's [[2011–12 UEFA Europa League knockout phase#Round of 16|Round of 16 Europa League]] fixture against [[Sporting Clube de Portugal]] on 15 March, Agüero netted a double to help City claim a 3–2 win, having been trailing 2–0 at half-time, to level the scores at 3–3 on aggregate. Sporting CP won on away goals, as they defeated Manchester City 1–0 in the first-leg on 8 March.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2012/matches/round=2000274/match=2007461/postmatch/report/index.html |title=UEFA Europa League 2011/12 – History – Man. City-Sporting – |publisher=Uefa.com |date=15 March 2012 |accessdate=12 June 2012}}</ref> One week later, Agüero scored his 17th league goal in 2–1 win against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] on 21 March.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en/match/60563/manchester-city-fc-vs-chelsea-fc/report |title=Match Report: Man City 2–1 Chelsea |publisher=Goal.com |date=21 March 2012 |accessdate=12 June 2012}}</ref> On 29 March, Agüero was ruled out for 10 days to two weeks due to a foot problem, which was later diagnosed as a reaction to a substance that blistered his foot.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/9177875/Mystery-over-Sergio-Agueros-stupid-foot-injury.html | location=London | work=The Daily Telegraph | title=Mystery over Sergio Aguero's 'stupid' foot injury | date=31 March 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=Reuters / PA Sport |url=http://uk.eurosport.yahoo.com/30032012/58/premier-league-stupid-injury-sidelines-aguero.html |title=Premier League – 'Stupid' injury sidelines Aguero – Yahoo! Eurosport |publisher=Uk.eurosport.yahoo.com |date= |accessdate=12 June 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/football/2012/mar/30/manchester-city-sergio-aguero?newsfeed=true | location=London | work=The Guardian | title=Manchester City's Sergio Agüero forced to miss Sunderland match | date=30 March 2012}}</ref> On 11 April, Agüero scored two goals for himself and also set up another two goals (for David Silva and [[Carlos Tevez]]) in a 4–0 home victory against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.soccerway.com/matches/2012/04/11/england/premier-league/manchester-city-football-club/west-bromwich-albion-football-club/1117363/ |title=Manchester City vs. West Bromwich Albion – 11 April 2012 |publisher=Soccerway |date=11 April 2012 |accessdate=12 June 2012}}</ref> On 14 April, Agüero scored a double in a 6–1 away win against Norwich City, his two goals meaning that he had surpassed 20 league goals in the Premier League.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.soccerway.com/matches/2012/04/14/england/premier-league/norwich-city-fc/manchester-city-football-club/1117374/ |title=Norwich City vs. Manchester City – 14 April 2012 |publisher=Soccerway |date=14 April 2012 |accessdate=12 June 2012}}</ref> He scored one goal in the next match, in which Manchester City beat [[Wolverhampton Wanderers]] 2–0.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en/match/60505/wolves-vs-manchester-city-fc/report |title=Match Report: Wolves 0–2 Man City |publisher=Goal.com |date=22 April 2012 |accessdate=12 June 2012}}</ref> On 4 May, Agüero was named [[2011–12 Manchester City F.C. season#Awards#Etihad Player of the Year awards|Manchester City Player of The Year]]. His first goal in the 6–1 away win against Norwich also won him the club's "Goal of the Season" award.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/9/england/2012/05/04/3079439/aguero-voted-manchester-city-player-of-the-year |title=Aguero voted Manchester City Player of the Year |publisher=Goal.com |date=4 May 2012 |accessdate=12 June 2012}}</ref>

=====Final game of the season: Manchester City 3–2 Queens Park Rangers=====
{{Quote box | width=30% | align=right| quote="In my career so far it's the most important goal. You score the goal in the last minute to win the title. You're not sure if that's ever going to happen in your career again. I wish I could tell you how I did it but I can't. I thought for all the world that [[Mario Balotelli|Mario]] [Balotelli] was going to have a go himself but he just moved it on one more and it fell at my feet and I just thought: 'Hit the target, hit it as hard as you can and hit the target.' And it went in."|source=<small>Sergio Agüero, on his [[last-minute goal]] against Queens Park Rangers in 2012 which won the Premier League for City.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Sergio Agüero predicts 'run of trophies' for champions Manchester City |url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/football/2012/may/14/sergio-aguero-champions-manchester-city |work=The Guardian |date=14 May 2012 |accessdate=15 May 2012 |location=London |first=Jamie |last=Jackson}}</ref></small> }}

Five straight wins helped City wipe out the eight-point deficit against United, and they went into the final days' fixtures leading on goal difference. Facing relegation-threatened [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]], City needed only to match or better United's result at [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]]. By the 66th minute, QPR (despite having a player sent off) went ahead 2–1 against City, while United were 1–0 up against Sunderland. In response, manager Roberto Mancini sent on strikers [[Edin Džeko]] and [[Mario Balotelli]] in an attempt to get the two goals City now needed for the title. 5 minutes of injury time begun for City with their and United's match scores still constant. In the 92nd minute, Džeko equalised for City for a glimmer of hope, but United soon finished their own game with a victory. In the 95th minute, Agüero, receiving the ball from Balotelli, drove into the penalty area and placed a powerful low shot into the corner of the goal, clinching the win and the title for Manchester City.<ref name="BBC2012">[http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17973148 "Man City snatch dramatic Premier League title win"]. BBC. Retrieved 13 May 2012</ref> Agüero's goal sent the [[City of Manchester Stadium]] into a frenzy and he was dragged to the floor jubilantly by his City team-mates. [[Vincent Kompany]] recalled that Agüero was crying on the floor,<ref>{{Cite news |title='Sergio was crying': Kompany relives the moments after City's last-gasp winner |url=http://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/sergio-aguero-cried-after-title-831767 |newspaper=Daily Mirror |date=13 May 2012 |accessdate=16 May 2012}}</ref> and when asked if he cried during the Manchester City parade the following day, Agüero stated: "Yeah, a little".<ref>{{Cite news |title=Sun shines on City's victory parade |url=http://football.uk.reuters.com/leagues/premiership/news/2012/05/14/28696966-9DFA-11E1-A903-020D8033923B.php |work=Reuters |date=14 May 2012 |accessdate=16 May 2012}}</ref>

====2012–13 season====
Agüero started the [[2012–13 in English football|2012–13]] season in the [[2012 FA Community Shield]] against Chelsea at [[Villa Park]] as Manchester City won 3–2.<ref>{{cite web|last=Smith |first=Ben |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19133978 |title=BBC Sport – Chelsea 2–3 Man City |publisher=BBC Sport |date=2012-08-12 |accessdate=2013-04-03}}</ref> In Manchester City's first league match, Agüero had to be stretchered off in the 13th minute of their home game against [[Southampton F.C|Southampton]] due to a knee injury.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://bleacherreport.com/articles/1303093-sergio-augero-injury-updates-on-manchester-city-stars-knee-injury |title=Sergio Aguero Injury: Updates on Manchester City Star's Knee Injury |first=Nicholas |last=Goss |publisher=[[Bleacher Report]] |date=19 August 2012 |accessdate=23 August 2012}}</ref> Agüero was an unused substitute in City's 3–2 defeat to [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] on 18 September 2012. Following the match, Agüero said he would have joined Real Madrid had they made an offer for him in 2011 but was left with "no option but to join City".<ref>{{cite news|author=Manchester City |url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/manchester-city/9552270/Sergio-Aguero-says-he-would-have-signed-for-Real-Madrid-but-was-left-with-no-option-but-to-join-Manchester-City.html |title=Sergio Agüero says he would have signed for Real Madrid but was left with 'no option but to join Manchester City' |publisher=Telegraph |date= 19 September 2012|accessdate=2013-03-25 |location=London}}</ref> Agüero made his return in a 1–1 home draw against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] in the Premier League and went on to score his first goal of the season against [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] on 29 September in a 2–1 away win in the Premier League.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mcfc.co.uk/News/Match-reports/2012/September/City-v-Arsenal-EPL-match-report-23-September |title=Man City versus Arsenal English Premier League match report – Manchester City FC |publisher=Mcfc.co.uk |date=2012-09-23 |accessdate=2013-04-03}}</ref><ref>[http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19684404 "Fulham 1–2 Manchester City"] BBC Sport. 29 September 2012. Retrieved 17 February 2013.</ref> He followed this up with another goal the following weekend against [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] in a 3–0 home win.<ref>[http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19768745 "Manchester City 3–0 Sunderland"] BBC Sport. 6 October 2012. Retrieved 17 February 2013.</ref> His next league goal came in a 2–1 win at home against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] on 11 November.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mcfc.co.uk/News/Match-reports/2012/November/City-v-Spurs-Premier-League-11-November-2012 |title=Man City v Spurs in Premier League match report – Manchester City FC |publisher=Mcfc.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2013-04-03}}</ref> He followed this up with another two goals the following weekend against [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] in a 5–0 win at home.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mcfc.co.uk/News/Match-reports/2012/November/City-v-Villa-EPL-17-Nov |title=Man City versus Aston Villa Barclays Premier League match report – Manchester City FC |publisher=Mcfc.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2013-04-03}}</ref> Agüero also scored in back-to-back games in the [[UEFA Champions League]], in successive draws at home to [[AFC Ajax|Ajax]] and Real Madrid.<ref>[http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20134308 "Man City 2–2 Ajax"] BBC Sport. 6 November 2012. Retrieved 17 February 2013.</ref><ref>[http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20321630 "Man City 1–1 Real Madrid"] BBC Sport. 22 November 2012. Retrieved 17 February 2013.</ref> He scored his next goal on 15 December, where he scored the opening goal, as Manchester City won 3–1 away against [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mcfc.co.uk/News/Match-reports/2012/December/Newcastle-v-City-EPL-15-Dec |title=Man City versus Newcastle in Barclays Premier League match report – Manchester City FC |publisher=Mcfc.co.uk |date=2012-12-15 |accessdate=2013-04-03}}</ref> Agüero then scored against [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]] on 29 December in a 4–3 away win.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mcfc.co.uk/News/Match-reports/2012/December/Norwich-v-City-Dec-29-2012 |title=Man City away at Norwich City in Premier League match report – Manchester City FC |publisher=Mcfc.co.uk |date=2012-12-29 |accessdate=2013-04-03}}</ref> In his next match on 2 January, after scoring a penalty in the 73rd minute, Agüero damaged his hamstring during a 3–0 victory over [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]].<ref>{{cite news|author=Press Association |url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/football/2013/jan/05/sergio-aguero-hamstring-tear-injury |title=Sergio Agüero confirms he has hamstring tear after tests in Italy |publisher=Guardian |date= 5 January 2013|accessdate=2013-03-25 |location=London}}</ref>

Agüero made his return for Manchester City on 19 January after coming on as an 81st minute substitute in a 2–0 victory against [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mcfc.co.uk/News/Match-reports/2013/January/City-v-Fulham-EPL-19-Jan |title=Manchester City versus Fulham in the Premier League match report – Manchester City FC |publisher=Mcfc.co.uk |date=2013-01-19 |accessdate=2013-04-03}}</ref> On 3 February, Agüero scored the equaliser after beating Liverpool goalkeeper Pepe Reina in a race to the ball out near the right corner flag.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mcfc.co.uk/News/Match-reports/2013/February/City-v-Liverpool-Feb-3-Premier-League |title=Man City versus Liverpool in Premier League match report – Manchester City FC |publisher=Mcfc.co.uk |date=2013-02-03 |accessdate=2013-04-03}}</ref> On 17 February, Agüero helped Manchester City to the quarter-finals of the [[2012–13 FA Cup|FA Cup]] as he scored twice in a 4–0 win at home to [[Leeds United A.F.C.|Leeds United]].<ref>[http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21449162 "Man City 4–0 Leeds"] BBC Sport. 17 February 2013. Retrieved 17 February 2013.</ref> He sustained a knee injury in the 2–0 win over [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] on 24 February.<ref>{{cite web|author=GMT |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21804553 |title=Man City's Vincent Kompany and Sergio Aguero close to return |publisher=BBC Sport |date=2013-03-15 |accessdate=2013-03-25}}</ref> This eventually led to him missing the Argentina squad for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification (CONMEBOL)|2014 FIFA World Cup qualification]] matches against [[Venezuela national football team|Venezuela]] and [[Bolivia national football team|Bolivia]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sportsmole.co.uk/football/argentina/news/sergio-aguero-leaves-argentina-squad_75066.html |title=Sergio Aguero leaves Argentina squad |publisher=Sports Mole |date= |accessdate=2013-03-25}}</ref> Agüero made his return for Manchester City on 30 March after coming on as a substitute with warm reception in a 4–0 victory against Newcastle.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mcfc.co.uk/News/Match-reports/2013/March/City-v-Newcastle-EPL-March-30 |title=Manchester City versus Newcastle United Premier League match report – Manchester City FC |publisher=Mcfc.co.uk |date=2013-03-30 |accessdate=2013-04-03}}</ref> On 8 April, Agüero scored a solo goal to give City the win in the [[Manchester derby]] in the 78th minute, 7 minutes after coming on as a [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] for [[Samir Nasri]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/manchester-united-vs-manchester-city-man-for-man-marking-8565175.html|title=Manchester United vs Manchester City: Man for man marking|date=8 April 2013|publisher=The Independent|location=London|first=Jack|last=Pitt-Brooke}}</ref> Agüero then scored a header to help Manchester City defeat Chelsea on 14 April in the FA Cup semi-final and reach the final.<ref>{{cite news|last=Purnell |first=Gareth |url=http://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/fa-league-cups/chelsea-1-manchester-city-2-match-report-yaya-toure-too-strong-for-slowstarting-chelsea-in-fa-cup-semifinal-8572461.html |title=Chelsea |url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/football/2013/apr/15/sergio-aguero-escapes-ban-stamp |title=Sergio Agüero showed his nasty side and some how escaped an FA sanction for two-footed horror tackle on David Agüero would not be punished following confirmation that referee [[Chris Foy (referee)|Chris Foy]] had at least seen part of the incident and acted on it during the match. Many people disagreed with this decision and felt that the FA had failed to act.<ref>{{cite news|last=Purnell |first=Gareth |url=http://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/fa-league-cups/manchester-city-striker-sergio-aguero-escapes-retrospective-action-following-five-seconds-of-anger-unleashed-on-david-luiz-8573971.html |title=Manchester City striker Sergio Aguero escapes retrospective action following 'seconds' of anger unleashed on David Luiz |publisher=The Independent |date=2013-04-15 |accessdate=2013-04-20 |url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/football/2013/apr/17/sergio-aguero-apologises-david-luiz |title=Sergio Agüero apologises to David Luiz after FA Cup semi-final lunge |publisher=The Guardian |date= 17 2013|accessdate=2013-05-24 |location=London}}</ref> On 11 May, Agüero started for Manchester City in the [[2013 FA Cup Final]], where the team lost 1–0 to Wigan Athletic. Agüero scored his final goal of the season in a 2–0 away win against [[Reading F.C.|Reading]] on 14 May.<ref>http://www.mcfc.co.uk/News/Match-reports/2013/May/Reading-v-City-14-May-2013-Premier-Leaguez</ref>

|url=http://as.com/diarioas/2013/05/21/english/1369167497_170406.html |title=Real Madrid still keen on signing City striker Agüero – 'The Times' |publisher=AS.com |date= |accessdate=2013-05-24}}<br |accessdate=2013-05-24}}</ref> However, Argentina legend [[Diego Maradona]] backed him to join Real Madrid, believing Agüero's presence in the Madrid team could help get even more out of [[Cristiano Ronaldo]].<ref>{{cite news|author=Graeme Yorke |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2287972/Maradona-Sergio-Aguero-Cristiano-Ronaldo-Real-Madrid-spectacular.html |title=Maradona: Sergio Aguero and Cristiano Ronaldo at Real Madrid would be spectacular |publisher=Dailymail.co.uk |date=2013-03-04 |accessdate=2013-03-25 |location=London}}</ref> On 25 May 2013, Agüero signed a one-year extension to his contract, keeping him at Manchester City until 2017.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.mcfc.co.uk/News/Team-news/2013/May/Aguero-signs-new-deal|title=City confirm Aguero contract extension|date=25 May 2013|accessdate=25 May 2013|publisher=Manchester City F.C. Sergio Aguero signs new Manchester City deal|date=25 May 2013|accessdate=25 May 2013|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> Agüero stated his commitment to Manchester City on 28 May 2013, saying "I'm committed to Manchester City, it's a great club."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-us/news/85/england/2013/05/28/4008519/sergio-aguero-insists-he-was-never-interested-in-real-madrid?ICID |title=Sergio Aguero insists he was never interested in Real Madrid |publisher=Goal.com |date=2013-05-28 |accessdate=2013-06-01}}</ref>

====2013–14 season====
[[File:Dzeko kickoff.jpg|thumb|Agüero and [[Edin Džeko]] about to kick-off against [[Cardiff City]] in August 2013]]
Following a knee injury that ruled him out of all of the club's pre-season games,<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/aug/08/sergio-aguero-manchester-city|title=Sergio Agüero in frame for Manchester City opener against Newcastle|date=8 August 2013|publisher=The Guardian}}</ref> Agüero scored in City's 4–0 victory over [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] in the opening game of the [[2013–14 Premier League]] season.<ref>http://talksport.com/football/man-city-4-0-newcastle-%E2%80%93-dream-start-pellegrini-blues-batter-ten-man-toon-13081956339</ref> On 22 September 2013, he scored a brace in a 4–1 home win against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/sep/22/manchester-city-united-premier-league|title=Manchester City make easy work of lacklustre Manchester United|date=22 September 2013|publisher=The Guardian}}</ref>

On 8 November 2013, after scoring five goals in four matches between 5 October and 2 November, Agüero was awarded the [[Premier League Player of the Month]] for the first time. During the same period, he had also scored both goals for City in a 2–1 away win against [[PFC CSKA Moscow|CSKA Moscow]] in the [[2013–14 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.mcfc.com/News/Team-news/2013/November/Sergio-Aguero-named-October-Barclays-Premier-League-Player-of-the-Month|title=Kun named league's best in October|date=8 November 2013|accessdate=10 January 2015|work=Manchester City Football Club}}</ref>

On 24 November, after scoring his ninth and tenth goals of the league season in a 6–0 win against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]], Agüero overtook [[Thierry Henry]] as the player with the highest goals-per-minute ratio in Premier League history.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2513150/Sergio-Aguero-deadliest-striker-Premier-League-history.html|title=Forget Henry, Van Nistelrooy, Shearer and co... this is why Aguero is now the deadliest striker in Premier League history|date=25 November 2013|accessdate=5 March 2014|work=Daily Mail|location=London|first=Nik|last=Simon}}</ref> He also scored six goals in five matches in the [[2013–14 UEFA Champions League group stage|Champions League group stage]] as Manchester City qualified for the [[2013–14 UEFA Champions League knockout phase|knockout phase]] for the first time.

On 14 December 2013, Agüero was substituted in a 6–3 win against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] due to a calf injury<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/dec/17/manchester-city-sergio-aguero-injury|title=Manchester City could be without injured Sergio Agüero for eight weeks|date=18 December 2013|accessdate=5 March 2014|work=The Guardian}}</ref> and missed eight matches.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://espnfc.com/news/story/_/id/1699560/manchester-city-striker-sergio-aguero-faces-month-injured?cc=3436|title=Sergio Aguero faces month out injured|date=31 January 2014|accessdate=5 March 2014|work=ESPN}}</ref> On 16 January 2014, he returned from injury in an [[2013–14 FA Cup|FA Cup]] third-round replay against [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]], scoring after coming on as a substitute in the 5–0 win.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/jan/15/manchester-city-blackburn-rovers-fa-cup|title=Manchester City's Álvaro Negredo inspires replay win over Blackburn|date=16 January 2014|accessdate=5 March 2014|work=The Guardian}}</ref> In the next round of the competition, he scored his first hat-trick of the season in a 4–2 victory over [[Watford F.C.|Watford]]. On 29 January, he scored his 50th Premier League goal in a 5–1 victory at Tottenham Hotspur<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/25838298|title=Tottenham 1–5 Man City|date=29 January 2014|accessdate=5 March 2014|work=BBC Sport}}</ref> but was substituted with a hamstring injury.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://talksport.com/football/agueros-injury-woes-continue-can-man-city-cope-without-their-star-man-14012977727|title=Aguero’s injury woes continue: Can Man City cope without their star man?|date=29 January 2014|accessdate=5 March 2014|work=Talksport}}</ref>

On 2 March 2014, Agüero returned to the Manchester City team for the [[2014 Football League Cup Final]], where the team beat [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] 3–1 at [[Wembley Stadium]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/26311649|title=Man City 3–1 Sunderland|date=2 March 2014|work=BBC Sport}}</ref> In his third appearance since returning from the hamstring problem, Agüero suffered a recurrence of the injury and was withdrawn at half-time in a 2–1 Champions League loss at Camp Nou against Barcelona.<ref>http://espnfc.com/news/story/_/id/1748558/manchester-city-sweat-new-sergio-aguero-injury?cc=5739</ref> He missed the team's next five Premier League matches, before returning to the starting line-up in a 3–2 loss against Liverpool at [[Anfield]] on 13 April.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/liverpool-v-manchester-city-sergio-aguero-returns-to-city-squad-for-crucial-premier-league-meeting-at-anfield-9254391.html|title=Liverpool v Manchester City: Sergio Aguero returns to City squad for crucial Premier League meeting at Anfield|date=11 April 2014|accessdate=22 April 2014|work=The Independent}}</ref>

On 21 April 2014, Agüero scored his first goal since January in a 3–1 defeat of West Bromwich Albion at the [[City of Manchester Stadium]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/27017161|title=Man City 3–1 West Brom|date=21 April 2014|accessdate=22 April 2014|work=BBC}}</ref> After scoring his final goal of the season in a 3–2 win over [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] at [[Goodison Park]] on 3 May, Agüero started for Manchester City against West Ham United as the team secured its second Premier League title in three seasons with a 2–0 win.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/27273582|title=Man City 2-0 West Ham|date=11 May 2014|accessdate=10 January 2015|work=BBC}}</ref>

====2014–15 season====
[[File:CSKA-MC (12).jpg|thumb|left|Agüero playing against [[PFC CSKA Moscow|CSKA Moscow]] in October 2014]]
On 14 August 2014, Agüero signed a five-year contract extension, which will keep him at Manchester City until 2019.<ref>{{cite news|title=Aguero signs new five-year contract at City|url=http://www.mcfc.com/News/Team-news/2014/August/Sergio-Aguero-signs-new-five-year-contract-at-City|work=[[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]]|date=14 August 2014|accessdate=17 August 2014}}</ref>

Agüero scored his first goal of [[2014–15 Manchester City F.C. season|2014–15]] while appearing as an 83rd minute substitute in City's opening match of the [[2014–15 Premier League|Premier League]] season against Newcastle United on 17 August.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/28730044|title=Manchester City began the defence of their Premier League title with a routine win at Newcastle thanks to David Silva and Sergio Aguero goals. |publisher=BBC.com |date=17 August 2014}}</ref>
Due to his late return from the World Cup, Agüero was again used as a substitute in the second game of the season against Liverpool, but, after replacing [[Edin Džeko]], took just 23 seconds to score City's third goal in the 3–1 win.<ref>http://uk.reuters.com/article/2014/08/26/uk-soccer-england-idUKKBN0GP1X620140826</ref>

On 18 October 2014, he scored all four of City's goals in a 4–1 home win over [[Tottenham Hotspur]], two of which were penalties; he took another penalty in the match, but it was saved by [[Hugo Lloris]]. This took Agüero to 61 Premier League goals for the club, surpassing Carlos Tevez as the club's record scorer in the competition.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Bevan|first1=Chris|title=Man City 4-1 Tottenham|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29580245|accessdate=18 October 2014|work=BBC Sport|date=18 October 2014}}</ref> He was the first player in the season to reach ten Premier League goals, doing so with the only goal in the [[Manchester derby]] on 2 November.<ref>{{cite news|last1=McNulty|first1=Phil|title=Man City 1-0 Man Utd|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29775977|accessdate=2 November 2014|work=BBC Sport|date=2 November 2014}}</ref>

 |quote  =  Aguero is every bit as important to them as [[Luis Suarez]] was to Liverpool last year or [[Gareth Bale]] to Tottenham Hotspur the year before.

Agüero scored a [[List of UEFA Champions League hat-tricks|hat-trick]] in City's 3–2 win over [[FC Bayern Munich]] in the [[2014–15 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] [[2014–15 UEFA Champions League group stage#Group E|group stage]] on 25 November, starting with a penalty which he won himself.<ref>{{cite news|title=Man City 3-2 Bayern Mun|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29363029|accessdate=25 November 2014|work=BBC Sport|date=25 November 2014}}</ref> Five days later, in his 100th Premier League match, he was wrongly booked for [[Diving (association football)|simulation]] by referee [[Mike Jones (referee)|Mike Jones]] after being fouled by [[José Fonte]] in the penalty area, although City went on to defeat Southampton 3–0.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Jurejko|first1=Jonathan|title=Southampton 0-3 Man City|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30166197|accessdate=30 November 2014|work=BBC Sport|date=30 November 2014}}</ref>

On 2 December, Agüero was named the [[Football Supporters' Federation|Football Supporters' Federation Player of the Year]] for 2014.<ref>http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11679/9589108/sergio-aguero-wins-player-of-the-year-award-in-football-supporters-federation-vote</ref> He was also awarded [[Premier League Player of the Month]] for November 2014, a month in which he scored three league goals and assisted two more.<ref>{{cite news|title=Alan Pardew & Sergio Aguero win Manager & Player awards|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30448255|accessdate=13 December 2014|work=BBC Sport|date=12 December 2014}}</ref>

Agüero sustained a knee injury in the second minute of Manchester City's 1–0 win over Everton on 6 December<ref>http://www.foxsports.com.au/football/premier-league/sergio-agueros-knee-injury-to-keep-him-out-for-4-6-weeks-man-city-boss-manuel-pellegrini-say/story-e6frf4a3-1227150686898?nk=61b9b73511bdf51eee7bf7c8f753623c</ref> and was unable to appear again for the remainder of 2014. He returned to City's matchday squad for the return fixture with Everton at Goodison Park on 10 January 2015<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/jan/09/sergio-aguero-returns-manchester-city-everton|title=Sergio Agüero returns to Manchester City squad for Everton game|date=10 January 2015|accessdate=10 January 2015|work=The Guardian}}</ref> and appeared as a 67th minute substitute in the 1–1 draw.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/30663863|title=Everton 1-1 Man City|date=10 January 2014|accessdate=11 January 2015|work=BBC}}</ref> On 11 February, Agüero scored his first two goals of 2015 in a 4–1 win at Stoke City.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.sbs.com.au/news/article/2015/02/12/last-gasp-willian-strike-keeps-chelsea-clear|title=Last-gasp Willian strike keeps Chelsea in the clear|date=12 February 2015|work=Special Broadcasting Services}}</ref> On 21 February, Agüero scored an early penalty in 72 seconds after Kick Off, Against [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]], It was also the second quickest penalty scored in Premier League history <ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.101greatgoals.com/blog/sergio-agueros-penalty-fastest-premier-league-1994|title=Sergio Aguero’s penalty was the fastest in the Premier League since 1994|date=21 February 2015|work=101greatgoals.com}}</ref> and City earn 5-0 win over [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]].
<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailystar.co.uk/sport/football/426942/Man-City-Newcastle-match-report|title=Citizens close gap to Chelsea|date=21 February 2015|work=Daily Star UK}}</ref>
{{clear}}

==International career==

===Youth teams===
Agüero made his senior debut for [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]] in a friendly with [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]], played at [[Emirates Stadium]], England on 3 September 2006.<ref name="Official"/> As a teenager, he represented Argentina at two [[FIFA U-20 World Cup|FIFA World Youth Championships]]. Together with future 2008 Olympics squad teammates [[Fernando Gago]] of [[Valencia CF|Valencia]] and [[Lionel Messi]] of [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]], they won the [[2005 FIFA World Youth Championship|2005 edition]] in the [[Netherlands]].

Agüero was selected for the [[Argentina national under-17 football team|Argentina U17]] team to participate at the [[:es:Campeonato Sudamericano Sub-16 de 2004|2004 U-16 South American Championship]] in Paraguay in September. He participated in all of Argentina's group stage matches, scoring in a 2–1 win against the [[United States men's national under-17 soccer team|United States]] and a 3–1 win against [[Ecuador national under-17 football team|Ecuador]] to help Argentina finish top of their group. Agüero scored in the 47th minute of Argentina's 1–0 quarter-final victory against [[Peru national under-17 football team|Peru]], setting up a semi-final match against [[Colombia national under-17 football team|Colombia]] which Argentina lost 2–0.

At the [[2007 FIFA U-20 World Cup|2007 U-20 World Cup]] in [[Canada]], he scored twice and helped set up three goals in a 6–0 win over [[Panama national under-20 football team|Panama]] in the second game of the group stage of the tournament. Agüero then scored the only goal in Argentina's third match against [[North Korea national under-20 football team|North Korea]] from a free kick. Having qualified to the round of 16, he scored two of the three goals against [[Poland national under-20 football team|Poland]] that would eventually give them a [[2007 FIFA U-20 World Cup#Round of 16|3–1]] win to advance to the next round. Argentina defeated [[Mexico national under-20 football team|Mexico]] in the quarter-finals and [[Chile national under-20 football team|Chile]] in the semi-finals, and faced the [[Czech Republic national under-20 football team|Czech Republic]] in the finals, a team they drew [[2007 FIFA U-20 World Cup#Group E|0–0]] in the group stage. Agüero captained and scored the equaliser in the 62nd minute, leading to a [[2007 FIFA U-20 World Cup#Final|2–1]] victory. In addition, Agüero won the Golden Boot of the tournament, scoring six goals in seven, and the Golden Ball as the best player of the tournament.

As a member of the Argentine squad for the [[Football at the 2008 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament|2008 Beijing Olympics]], Agüero scored two goals in the space of five minutes in the semi-final [[Football at the 2008 Summer Olympics - Men's tournament#Semi-finals|3–0]] win over [[Brazil national under-23 football team|Brazil]] on 19 August 2008.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.independent.co.uk/sport/olympics/argentina-3-brazil-0-argentina-in-final-after-routing-arch-rivals-902777.html|title=Argentina 3 Brazil 0: Argentina in final after routing arch rivals|author=Nick Harris|publisher=The Independent|date=20 August 2008|accessdate=5 June 2009 | location=London}}</ref> Argentina went on to win the gold medal, a second in a row at the Olympic tournament.

===Senior team===
Agüero debuted for the [[Argentina national football team|Argentina senior team]] at the age of 18 against [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]] in September 2006.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.fifa.com/worldcup/players/player=228528/profile-detail.html|title=Sergio AGUERO|accessdate=22 June 2014|work=FIFA}}</ref> A year later, he scored his first international goal in a [[2010 FIFA World Cup qualification (CONMEBOL)|2010 FIFA World Cup qualification]] match against [[Bolivia national football team|Bolivia]], and went on to score three more times as the ''Albiceleste'' successfully qualified for the finals in [[South Africa]].
[[File:Sergio Agüero (L), Ricardo Rodriguez (C), Valentin Stocker (R) - Switzerland vs. Argentina, 29th February 2012.jpg|thumb|Agüero taking on two Swiss players in an international friendly in 2012]]
Agüero was chosen for the [[2010 FIFA World Cup]] squad, and made his [[FIFA World Cup]] debut in Argentina's second group match against [[Korea Republic national football team|South Korea]] on 12 June 2010, replacing [[Carlos Tevez]] in the 75th minute. Agüero's impact was immediate as Argentina scored in the next minute. He assisted on [[Gonzalo Higuaín]]'s hat-trick goal late in the game. Argentina won the game [[2010 FIFA World Cup Group B#Argentina vs Korea Republic|4–1]]. Argentina, however, subsequently lost to [[Germany national football team|Germany]] in the [[2010 FIFA World Cup knockout stage#Argentina vs Germany|quarter-finals]].

Agüero was named in the 23-man squad for the [[2011 Copa América]] where Argentina had been drawn into Group A with [[Bolivia national football team|Bolivia]], [[Colombia national football team|Colombia]], and [[Costa Rica national football team|Costa Rica]]. On 1 July, in Argentina's opening [[2011 Copa América Group A|group stage]] match against Bolivia, he was substituted on to the field for [[Ezequiel Lavezzi]] on 71 minutes and scored an equaliser on 76 minutes to secure a 1–1 draw.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/3710/copa-america/2011/07/02/2557071/super-sub-sergio-aguero-rescues-argentina-as-lavezzi-tevez-messi- |title=Super-sub Sergio Aguero rescues Argentina as Lavezzi, Tevez & Messi combination fails to ignite |publisher=Goal.com |date=2 July 2011 |accessdate=24 August 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://df1.conmebol.com/copaamerica/fichas/ficha99064.html |title=Ficha del partido |publisher=Df1.conmebol.com |date= |accessdate=24 August 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5jEBbYw6n64iTgXh4lx-G4FCtRo-w?docId=CNG.117d0714f5b672226d5b5b12cdfa5987.341 |title=AFP: Argentine media round on Copa America flops |publisher=Google.com |date=1 July 2011 |accessdate=24 August 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|author='+ dateCreated +' |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/match_report/0,,11065_3368824,00.html |title=Match Report &#124; Argentina v Bolivia – 2 July 2011 &#124; Sky Sports &#124; Football News |publisher=Sky Sports |date=2 July 2011 |accessdate=24 August 2011}}</ref> On 6 July he was again substituted onto the field for Lavezzi on 64 minutes as Argentina drew 0–0 with Colombia in their second group stage fixture.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://df1.conmebol.com/copaamerica/fichas/ficha99066.html |title=Ficha del partido |publisher=Df1.conmebol.com |date= |accessdate=24 August 2011}}</ref> On 11 July in Argentina's third group stage match against Costa Rica, Agüero scored a goal in each half as Argentina won 3–0 and finished in second position of their group.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://df1.conmebol.com/copaamerica/fichas/ficha99069.html |title=Ficha del partido |publisher=Df1.conmebol.com |date= |accessdate=24 August 2011}}</ref>

Agüero was named in Argentina's 23-man squad for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]].<ref>{{cite news|title=World Cup 2014: Argentina leave out Carlos Tevez and Erik Lamela|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27403312|accessdate=21 May 2014|newspaper=[[BBC Sport]]|date=13 May 2014}}</ref> On 15 June, he started alongside Lionel Messi as a forward in Argentina's 2–1 win against [[Bosnia and Herzegovina national football team|Bosnia and Herzegovina]] at the [[Estádio do Maracanã]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/25285099|title=Argentina 2–1 Bos-Herce|date=16 June 2014|accessdate=22 June 2014|work=BBC}}</ref>

==Style of play==
{{Quote box
 |quote  =  Sergio is a photocopy of [[Romário]], they are the same player
|source =— [[Roberto Mancini]].<ref name="Romário"/>
 |align = right
 |quoted = 1
 | width = 33%
}}
Agüero is a striker and is regarded as an all-out [[centre forward]],<ref>{{Cite news |title=Ardiles: 'Aguero lives to score goals' |url=http://www.talksport.co.uk/sports-news/football/premier-league/9911/4/exclusive-ardiles-aguero-lives-score-goals |work=Talksport |date=16 August 2011}}</ref> but can also play as a [[second striker]] off another striker, which he often did at Atlético Madrid with [[Diego Forlán]],<ref name="milli">{{Cite news |title=Manchester City's Sergio Agüero 'only needs a millisecond to make a difference. He is that dangerous' |last=Smith |first=Rory |url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/manchester-city/8666970/Manchester-Citys-Sergio-Aguero-only-needs-a-millisecond-to-make-a-difference.-He-is-that-dangerous.html |newspaper=The Telegraph |date=28 July 2011 |location=London}}</ref> due to his passing ability and vision, which made him a capable assist-man.<ref>{{cite web|title=Aguero, classe da vendere|url=http://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/Primo_Piano/2007/07_Luglio/13/aguero.shtml|accessdate=22 September 2014}}</ref> Agüero has a diminutive figure with a stocky build, which has led to comparisons with former Manchester City teammate [[Carlos Tevez]]<ref>{{Cite news |title=Sergio Aguero and Carlos Tevez: Head-to-head |url=http://menmedia.co.uk/manchestereveningnews/sport/football/manchester_city/s/1454047_sergio-aguero-and-carlos-tevez-head-to-head |newspaper=Manchester Evening News |date=28 July 2011}}</ref> and past strikers such as [[Romário]], [[Alessandro Del Piero|Del Piero]], and [[Diego Maradona]]. Some pundits go as far to say Agüero is Tevez's heir apparent at City<ref>{{Cite news |title=Sergio Aguero is heir apparent to Carlos Tevez and can write golden chapter in City's rise to riches story |last=Smith |first=Rory |url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/manchester-city/8646329/Sergio-Aguero-is-heir-apparent-to-Carlos-Tevez-and-can-write-golden-chapter-in-Citys-rise-to-riches-story.html |newspaper=The Telegraph |date=18 July 2011 |location=London}}</ref> and is superior to Tevez.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Sergio Agüero is so much more than Carlos Tevez Mark 2 |last=Lowe |first=Sid |url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/football/blog/2011/jul/27/sergio-aguero-manchester-city |newspaper=The Guardian |date=27 July 2011 |location=London}}</ref> His ex-manager at Manchester City, [[Roberto Mancini]], has compared Agüero to former Brazilian striker, Romário, due to his goalscoring ability and technique.<ref name="Romário">{{Cite news |title=Man City boss Mancini compares Sergio Aguero to Romario |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/14538374.stm |work=BBC Sport |date=16 August 2011}}</ref>

Agüero is characterised by agility, acceleration and strength, being described as "sharp and clever" by former Argentine player [[Osvaldo Ardiles]].<ref>{{Cite news |title='Incredibly good value': Ossie Ardiles gives his verdict on new Manchester City signing Sergio Aguero |url=http://menmedia.co.uk/manchestereveningnews/sport/football/manchester_city/s/1454108_incredibly-good-value-ossie-ardiles-gives-his-verdict-on-new-manchester-city-signing-sergio-aguero |newspaper=Manchester Evening News |date=29 July 2011}}</ref> A view which is shared by his international [[Captain (association football)|captain]] [[Lionel Messi]], who believes Agüero possesses "immense power, strength and an incredible work ethic."<ref>{{Cite news |title=Aguero is 'incredible' and will spark City, insists Barcelona superstar Messi |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2025854/Manchester-City-new-boy-Sergio-Aguero-incredible-insists-Lionel-Messi.html |newspaper=Daily Mail |date=14 August 2011 |location=London}}</ref> Combined with his close control, dribbling skills, and strength to keep the ball, he has been described as "a menace in the box".<ref name="milli"/>

==Nickname==
Agüero's nickname "Kun," which features on his shirt, derives from his childhood and was first given to him by his grandparents.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2027348/Sergio-Aguero-use-Kun-Manchester-City-shirt.html |title=Yes you Kun! New City star Aguero told he can use nickname on his shirt |publisher=Daily Mail |date=18 August 2011 |accessdate=24 August 2011 |location=London}}</ref><ref name="kun">{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/europe/7384547.stm |title=BBC SPORT &#124; Football &#124; Europe &#124; The rise of Sergio Aguero|publisher=BBC News |date=7 May 2008 |accessdate=24 August 2011}}</ref> It came about due to a resemblance to the character "[[Kum-Kum]]" from Agüero's favourite television programme as a child.<ref name="kun" /> The player himself has said about it "I have grown to appreciate it because it's unique. It's not every day an athlete is nicknamed after a cartoon character!"<ref name="kun" />

==Personal life==
Agüero was married to Giannina Maradona, the youngest daughter of Argentine football legend [[Diego Maradona]]. On 19 February 2009, Giannina gave birth to their son, Benjamín, in Madrid, Spain.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/worldFootballNews/idUKLJ7605820090219|publisher=Reuters|title=Maradona a grandfather thanks to Atletico's Agüero | date=19 February 2009}}</ref> Diego Maradona was there for the birth of his first grandson, while Agüero, then 20, missed Atlético's training session earlier in the day. Atlético offered their congratulations in a statement on their official website.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.clubatleticodemadrid.com/en/atleticoaldia/noticias.asp?id=3520|title=Benjamín Agüero Maradona is born on Thursday 19 February and weighs 3.660 kilos|publisher=Atletico Madrid}}</ref> Agüero and Giannina separated in 2012 after four years together.<ref>{{cite news|first=Todd|last=Fitzgerald|url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/news/greater-manchester-news/manchester-citys-sergio-aguero-splits-1209630|newspaper=Manchester Evening News|title=Manchester City's Sergio Aguero splits from wife of four years|date=4 January 2013|accessdate=28 March 2015}}</ref>

Agüero has a [[tattoo]] on the inside of his right arm, inscribed in [[Tengwar]]—a form of writing invented by [[J. R. R. Tolkien]] that was used by the [[Elf (Middle-earth)|Elves]] in [[The Lord of the Rings|his works]]. It transliterates roughly to ''Kun Agüero'' in the [[Latin alphabet]]. He also has a tattoo on his left arm with his son's name and date of birth.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vanishingtattoo.com/tattoo/celeb-aguero.htm|title=Sergio Agüero Tattoos|publisher=Vanishing Tattoo|accessdate=5 June 2009}}</ref>
